texts.es: Reina Beatriz Q. D. M. D. 42 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo y un hijo en el Municipio D. San Martin del  Departamento D. San Salvador. Doña Reina posee un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en una tienda en la que ofrece productos D. primera necesidad como: bebidas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, detergente, jabón, etc. Tiene mucho tiempo D. trabajar en su tienda y gracias a su carisma  y dedicación en el trabajo ha logrado posicionarse en la zona y cada día su clientela aumenta más. Es muy conocida y respetada por sus vecinos ya que ella siempre se preocupa por brindar el mejor servicio posible a sus clientes. Su sueño es  ampliar su tiendita surtiéndola con variedad D. productos. Por esta razón solicita este crédito con la esperanza puesta en Dios que logrará atraer a más clientes que le demanden sus productos y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias. Con el crédito pretenD. comprar variedad D. artículos D. primera necesidad como: golosinas, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, detergente, papel higiénico, entre otros artículos atractivos para los clientes. D. esta manera espera lograr mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia y ayudar a su hijo a superarse.
texts.en: Reina Beatriz Q. D. M. is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son in the San Martin municipality of the San Salvador department.  Doña Reina has a small business which consists of a store in which she carries basic products such as beverages, rice, beans, sugar, candy, detergents, soap, etc..  She has been working at this store for some time and thanks to her charisma and dedication she has been able to position herself in the area, and her customer base increases every day.  She is well known and respected by her neighbors as she always makes sure to proviD. the best service possible to her customers.  Her dream is to grow her store by supplying it with a variety of products.  For this reason she is requesting this loan, with her hope placed in God's hands she expects to attract more customer that will need her merchandise and this way obtain larger profits. With the money from the loan she will buy a variety of basic products such as candy, beverages,rice, sugar beans, soap, detergent, toilet paper and other articles that will attract customers.  In this way she hopes to improve the quality of life of her family and help her son to succeed.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic products such as candies, sodas, rice, sugar, beans, soap, detergents,toilet paper among other merchandise desired by the customers.

loans.name: Saba Saba Group

texts.en:
Abdllah M., who is in his early 50s, is married with five children. Some of the children are still in school. He has been selling second clothes and second hand shoes since 1982.  He works from 8:30am to 6:30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Abdllah's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start selling second hand shoes and has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock of second hand clothes and shoes. His dream is to one day have a big place where he can sell his products.

Abdlla will share this loan with his loan group "Saba saba", which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Abdllah is in the middle of the last row in a black shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock of second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Deivis

texts.es: Deivis es un joven de 29 años que vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 16 años y 4 meses  en Ciudad Bicentenario, macroproyecto objeto de intervención de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su ejercicio misional  de construir comunidades auto sostenibles.  Desde allí Deivis  ofrece sus servicios como técnico en pulimento de vehículos, actividad que inició cuando buscando ingresos para su hogar,  decidió ofrecer sus servicios de lavado de  vehículos por  principales avenidas de la ciudad, pero como Deivis es un joven de muchas aspiraciones logró dar otro  matiz , una vez  realizó estudios de pulimiento y mantenimiento externo de vehículos, logrando su título como técnico en esta actividad, en la que se desempeña con mucho esmero y sueña con hacerla crecer, porque más adelante su meta es tener un local propio para aumentar su reconocimiento, ofreciendo servicios más efectivos a sus clientes y con ello lograr aumentar sus ingresos, con tal de fomentar el bienestar de su familia y ofrecerle una educación de calidad a  sus hijos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  con él comprará materias primas para la preparación de productos de limpieza y cera para el pulimiento de vehículos. Su mayor desafío es atender a sus clientes sin tener  un puesto fijo, por eso todos los días trabaja con el fin de ahorrar y lograr un espacio bien organizado donde desarrollar su actividad.
texts.en:
Deivis is a young man who is 29 years of age. He lives with his wife and their two children (ages 16 and 4 months) in Ciudad Bicentenario, a large-scale housing and intervention project undertaken by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The mission of this project is to build self-sustaining communities.

In this community, Deivis offers car wash services. He started this business because he needed a way to earn household income. Deivis decided to offer his services to vehicles that travel along the main avenues of the city. Being a young man with many aspirations started to give him more purpose. As soon he completed courses in polishing and maintaining vehicle exteriors, he became certified as a technician to work in this type of business. His skill is demonstrated through the great care he takes in making his business grow. Going forward his goal is to have his own location where can he can attract more business, offer more effective services to his customers, and generate more income to help him provide for the welfare of his family and pay for a quality education for his children.

This Kiva loan is his first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Deivis will use the funds to buy materials for preparing cleaning products and car wax for polishing vehicles. His greatest challenge is attending to his customers without having an established location. For this reason, he works every day so that he can save toward acquiring an organized space where he can develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning materials and car wax.

loans.name: Olin

texts.es: Olin, de 21 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, está casado con Yeny, de 19 años, producto de su gran amor nació Oliver que ahora tiene 10 meses de nacido; los tres viven en su casa alquilada ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Punpuriani). Todas las mañanas, desde las primeras horas del día se dirige a su terreno de cultivo, donde cuida plátanos y yuca; que hace dos años viene plantando con mucho esmero y cuidado y que muy pronto podrá cosechar plátanos para luego venderlos a los comerciantes que vienen constantemente a la comunidad. Según cuenta, tiene 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que la sustentan económicamente y el cual se cosecha cada 15 días, produciéndole constantemente ganancias. Lo que más le gusta es poder ver como su esfuerzo tiene buenos resultados, a pesar de tener poco tiempo en la agricultura. De las 3 cuadras de terreno que posee le falta uno para ser sembrado, por lo que sembrará café y muy pronto construirá una casa para su esposa y su hijo. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para disponer del capital para continuar con su trabajo agrícola. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Olin de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café que hace poco sembró.
texts.en:
Olin, 21, is a good and hardworking man. He is married to Yeny, 19, and out of their great love was born Oliver who is now 10 months old. The three of them live in a rented house located in the Peruvian jungle (native community of Punpuriani Center). Each morning at dawn he goes to his plot of land where he is tending bananas and yucca, having begun planting with a lot of effort and care two years ago. He will be able to harvest bananas very soon in order to sell them to the merchants that regularly visit the community. According to Olin he has two hectares of agricultural land that support him economically and which he harvests every two weeks, bringing in regular profits. 

What he likes most is to see how his effort brings good results, in spite of having only worked in agriculture a short while. Of the three blocks of land he owns, one remains to be sowed. He plans to sow coffee plants, and very soon will build a house for his wife and son. Thus he hopes for the support of each of you in order to have the capital he needs to continue on in his farming work. 

He belongs to the communal bank "Abejitas de Pumpuriani" [Little Bees of Pumpuriani]. This is his second loan with MFP, where he hopes for a small loan with which to achieve his objectives. Therefore he promises once again to make his payments as he did with his previous loans. He is pleased to be a member of his communal bank because all of its members are responsible people and mutually supportive. Once he receives his support, Olin will invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of organic compost for spreading on the land where his coffee crop was recently sowed.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Jameelan's Group

texts.en:
Jameelan is married and has no children. To pass her time and to help her husband financially, she operates a sewing business. She learned this skill from her mother in her teenage years and now she is good at it. She receives orders from her community clients and earns well after completing the orders on time. She also knows how to do embroidery but doesn’t do it on a regular basis. 

Her husband has a business doing floor polishing. He has a polishing machine and he uses it to polish floors. He is very good at his work and provides services to his customers for a reasonable fee. 

Jameelan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine which will help her finish orders on time. Her current machine has become old and takes much time to sew a single dress. 

She has been operating her business for the past six years and is very hopeful that the investment will help her in making her business more profitable. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado  y vive con su esposa e hijo que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizarla compra de mas cantidad de verduras para la venta. El cuanta con un carro para la venta de verduras y ya tiene una ruta establecida y lo que el pretende es ofrecerle a sus compradores una mejor cantidad de suministros y mayor variedad. El con esta compra de verduras mejorara su clientela y tendrá mayores ingresos para su bienestar familiar y salir adelante con todas sus responsabilidades como jefe de hogar. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
41-year old Edwin is married and lives with his wife and son who are the most important aspect of his life. With the loan money he plans to buy more vegetables to sell. He has a cart from which he sells the vegetables on an established route, and he hopes to offer his customers a larger quantity and a wider variety of produce. In this way Edwin will increase his customer base and earn more money for his family. As head of the household he will be able to take on more responsibilities.

This is his second loan from Kiva partner Fudecosur. He hasn’t had any loans with national banks in the past, but Fudecosur has offered him a loan with better repayment options and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida makes and sells crab nets. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and has been in this business for 20 years. She earns an additional income from ready-to-wear (second-hand) clothing sales. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase bamboo for making crab nets as well as to buy ready-to-wear clothing to offer for sale.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for making crab nets as well as to buy ready-to-wear clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Ashraf Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Ashraf bibi is 46 years old, married and has six children: four sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has completed his education till eighth standard and started working as a welder. The next oldest is in fifth standard, her third son is in kindergarten, while the youngest one is three years old. Both her daughters are in fifth standard. 

Ashraf is an uneducated lady involved in the livestock business. She sells animals and their milk as well. She does this work to support her family financially. She has been in this profession for the past 12 years. Her husband is a welder by profession. 

Ashraf has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her livestock business. With the loan, she will buy a buffalo to be able to increase milk production and also increase the sales. She is very hopeful that this investment will prove a profitable one for her business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for selling milk

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La señora Maria, es habitante del municipio de Masaya, junto a su esposo e hijas, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre en sus estudios a sus pequeñas ya que su sueño es verlas realizadas con una carrera profesional, doña Maria desde hace varios años labora como laboratorista en un hospital  , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta  con un salario suficientemente alto , para poder comprar de un solo vez  la cerámica y materiales de construcción  que necesita para una  pequeña bodega que quiere  construir ; ya  que si logra esto tendría más espacio en su casa de habitación ya que su         sala tiene muchas herramientas de trabajo.Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo kiva .
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and daughters in the Masaya municipality.  Her plans for the future are to improve their living conditions and to always support her little ones’ education.  Her dream is for them to have professional careers.

For several years Maria has been working in a lab at a hospital.  The greatest difficulty that she has is that her salary is not high enough.

She wants to be able to purchase, all at once, the tile and construction materials that she needs.  The materials are for a small grocery store that she wants to build.  If she does this she will have more space in her house; there are a lot of work tools in her living room.

She is grateful for the support Afodenic has provided through a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is in his forties and is engaged in rice farming. He is married and has three children who go to school. Fidel has been patiently managing his farm business for almost 15 years. His profits were spent on school fees for his children.
Fidel's wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their farm. Fidel dreams that somebody will lend to him at a low interest rate for the maintenance of his farm. Thus, Fidel is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care. The loan will be the answer to his dreams.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Tserentogtoh

texts.en:
Tserentogtoh is 35 years old and lives with his two sons and wife in a ger in Ovorhangai province of Mongolia. His wife works as a tailor at the local fashion salon. His eldest son is a high school student. The youngest son attends the local kindergarten. 

Tserentogtoh started his business back in 2004 by serving (transporting) people by motorcycle. In 2006, he bought his car and became a taxi driver ever since. He has 7 years of work experience. He's already made a regular client base. At the same time, he provides a call-taxi service. 

Within 2011, he took three loans from XacBank and bought furniture sets to his house. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy petrol and repair his car to increase his capital turnover.

loans.use: To buy petrol and repair his car

loans.name: Marieto

texts.en:
Marieto is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Marieto has a shop that buys and sells coconuts for copra. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts for copra. Marieto is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marieto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 60 years old and married. She has four children. Rosalina earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000, through NWTF, to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalina has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from raising other livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a 37-year-old single parent with two children living in a three-bedroom house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to educate his children to higher levels of learning and to become a model farmer. He has been in the business of mixed farming for five years and has been challenged by the rainy season and the constant animal diseases. Edson needs the loan to plough the garden and buy iron sheets for his house

loans.use: to plough the garden and buy iron sheets

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 44 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Angel Fajardo en el municipio de Chamelecon. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 27 y 7 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando.

Maria se convirtió en microempresaria hace 15 años cuando empezó una mini-farmacia. En su farmacia vende medicamentos de primera necesidad como aspirinas, antiácidos y jarabes. También da charlas de enfermería. Viendo que su clientela crecía, ella empezó a solicitar créditos para surtir aún más el negocio. Según ella, sus mayores desafíos son la delincuencia implacable de la zona y las inundaciones en temporada de lluvia. 

Maria ha solicitado varios créditos con ODEF, de forma individual y grupal. Este crédito de L6,000 es su séptimo crédito. Lo va a utilizar para la compra de medicinas para aumentar su inventario de medicamentos. Maria nota que su meta de poner un negocio propio ya se cumplió y que ahora sólo queda superarse más.
texts.en:
María, 44, lives in the village of Ángel Fajardo in the township of Chamelecón.  She’s married and has two children who are 27 and 7 years old; they are both studying.

María became a micro businesswoman 15 years ago when she opened a mini-pharmacy.  She sells basic medicines like aspirin, antacids and syrups in her pharmacy.  She also gives health lectures.  Seeing that her clientele was growing she started asking for loans to better stock the business.  According to her, her greatest challenges are the implacable delinquency in the area and the floods during the rainy season.

María has asked for several ODEF loans both as an individual and as part of a group.  This L6,000 loan is her 7th and she’ll use it to buy medicine to increase her stock inventory.  María notes that she’s reached her goal of setting up a business of her own and now all that remains is to improve still more

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.es: Crisanta D. 56 años D. edad casado con Julián D. 56 años fruto D. este amor tienen 2 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado D. Puerto Amargura del distrito D. LLochegua. DesD. hace 27 años Crisanta viene dedicándose con mucho esmero y perseverancia en la actividad agrícola, con el único fin D. lograr una D. sus metas trazadas y darles una buena educación, alimentación y estabilidad a sus queridos hijos. Si bien al comienzo ella solo contaba con una pequeña parcela D. cultivo D. cacao, por lo que decidió ampliar su terreno, para así producir en grandes volúmenes. Ella trabaja en compañía D. su querido esposo y sus 2 hijos, pero a la vez tiene a su cargo peones que puedan facilitarle en el cultivo D. su producto D. cacao. Una vez recolectado sus productos ella los expenD. a los acopiadores que pagan un buen precio. En un futuro piensa trabajar en la agricultura, adquiriendo nuevos terrenos para cultivar nuevos productos que tengan mayor demanda en el mercado nacional como el Sacha inchi, el Mani y frutas cítricas. Este será su segundo préstamos con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la adquisición D. semillas D. plátano y maní.
texts.en:
Crisanta, 56, is married to Julián, also 56, and they have two children.  The live in their own house in the center of Puerto Amargura in the district of LLochegua.  For the last 27 years, Crisanta has been a careful and persistent farmer, her only aim being to achieve her goals and to give her beloved children a good education, food, and stability.  At first, she started with a small plot of cocoa, then she decided to expand her land to increase her volume of production,  She works with her dear husband and two children, but she also has day laborers, who help her with  the cocoa cultivation.  Once her products are harvested, she sells them to buyers, who give her a good price.  In the future, she expects to continue farming, acquiring more land to raise new products that are in greater demand in the national market, such as Sacha Inchi (Inca peanuts), peanuts, and citrus fruits.  

This will be her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to pay her installments on time.  She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles ($750) to buy banana and peanut seeds.

loans.use: to buy banana and peanuts seeds.

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johanna de 21 años, es madre desde los 17 años, su esposo trabaja pero su sueldo no alcanza para mantener el hogar, por eso johanna trabaja vendiendo productos yambal para ayudar a mantener su hogar.

Su única dificultad es la delincuencia. Está casada su esposo es pintor, y tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. Quiee el prestamo para comprar perfumes, cremas y bisuterías.  

Su meta es poder tener un negocio estable y generar más ingresos para así darles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Johanna is 21 years old and has been a mother since she was 17 years of age. Her husband works but his salary is not sufficient enough to maintain their home which is why Johanna helps by selling Yanbal products.

Her only challenge is delinquency. She is married to her husband who is a painter and they have a 4 year old and 2 year old. She is requesting the loan to buy perfumes, creams, and jewelry.

Her goal is to have a stable business and make more profits to offer her children a good future.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, and jewelry.

loans.name: Muhiddinhuja

texts.ru: Мухиддинходжа парень 24 лет, холостой, самостоятельный бизнесмен. Он занимается продажей мужской одежды и обуви. Получает у нас кредиты с 2007 года. За товаром ездит в Бишкек сам один раз в месяц. Раньше он продавал только мужскую обувь и постепенно он расширил и добавил ассортимент мужскую одежду. Его точка находится на вещевом рынке города. Планирует привезти на очередной кредит партию тёплых мужских сорочек. Он искренне благодарен за доверие и поддержку организации.
texts.en: Muhiddinhuja is a 24 year-old young, single man, who is an independent businessman.  He is involved in selling men's clothing and shoes.  He has been obtaining loans from us since 2007.  Muhiddinhuja travels for his merchandise himself to Bishkek once per month.  He previously sold only men's shoes and then gradually added men's clothing to his goods selection.  His retail outlet is located at the city's clothing market.  Muhiddinhuja plans to use this loan to bring in an inventory of men's warm shirts.  He is genuinely grateful for the organization's trust and support.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of men's warm shirts

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 36 years old and has a common-law husband and two children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Almira runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Almira has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Almira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
45-year-old Hakob owns a metal lathe turning shop. He moved to this new place in January 2011 because he needed a wider place to do his business. He works in turning metals from non-useful to useful ones in addition to manufacturing non-existing metals on request.

Such a business is highly recommended but requires enough capital to keep buying updated machines.

Hakob is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new, updated machine that is necessary for his business.

This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His last loan was also invested in buying a necessary machine, the thing that he intends to continue buying in the future.

Hakob is a married man with one child. He works hard to provide him with the best education and healthy living. He hopes to keep improving and developing his business and social life.

loans.use: To buy a new, updated machine necessary for his business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. 

Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. 

Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education and, as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Pamela is married, and has seven children, some of whom are pictured with her above. Pamela farms their land and takes care of their children and two orphans, as well. She has been farming for ten years and is currently growing cabbage, sweet potatoes, onions, maize, bananas, and sunflowers on their land. 

Pamela thinks that beekeeping is a beneficial business because bees will pollinate her sunflowers and honey has medicinal properties, as well. 

This is Pamela’s first loan with Honey Care Africa and Kiva and she plans to use the income from her hives to pay her children’s school fees and to increase her farming activities. 

In the future, Pamela hopes to see her children healthy, well-fed, and regularly attending school. She thanks her Kiva lenders and says “I would like to get in touch with them.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a youthful 29-year-old mother, who is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Ruth is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and she grows maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Ruth has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: “I have to do something for my family“. Ruth joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Ruth is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Ruth to achieve her dream and reach her goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Ruth feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male smallholder farmer counterparts. The benefits of this loan are many because Ruth will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase. Ruth is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Ruth will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren of a secure future.
Support a humble farmer with a loan so that she can get ahead with her farming!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mayra Victoria

texts.en:
My name is Marya and I own a grocery store located in my own home, I have had it for 4 years and it has grown considerable. At this time, I need to invest fresh capital in order to stock the products I sell and many more. With my earnings I am able to help my children in their studies and my family with their daily expenses.

Mi nombre es Mayra y tengo una pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitacion, tengo 4 años de tenerla y ha crecido considerablemente, en este momento necesito invertir capital fresco para poder surtir los productos y vender mucho mas. Con los ingresos que percibo he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios y a mi familia con los gastos de toda la familia.

loans.use:
To purchase sodas, bread, milk, beans, sugar, chicken, milk products and other items.

Compra de refrescos, pan, leche, frijoles, azucar, pollo, lacteos y otros.

loans.name: Chot

texts.en:
Chót is married to Thanh; they have 1 girl. She has already dropped out of school and plans to search for work in another province. She studied till grade 10.

Chót and Thanh take care of Chót's mother, 80. Their household income is equivalent to $10/person/month. Thành's work is to cut and sell water hyacinths; there are plenty on the rivers of the delta.

They want to raise pigs. They used to have some before but had to stop due to a lack of capital, caused by falling prices. If they succeed, this could give them an extra $25 income in 4-5 months.

loans.use: Raise pigs as complementary income

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram M. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He owns a small store where he provides games like  Nintendo and Playstation  for young boys who like to play electronic games.. In Azerbaijan, the cost of owning personal game consoles is much too high for many families in the regions. Akram is helping to keep boys off the streets by providing them with a place to go to have fun after school hours. Akram is requesting his first loan with Normicro of $575 to purchase a new television, game console, and a few new games.

loans.use: To purchase a television, game console, and new games

loans.name: Elvia Minerva

texts.es:
Elvia is married and lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo León. Her huband is a teacher, and four years ago suffered an accident which prevented him from continuing his work. To be able to obtain the resources they needed, Elvia started to sell jewelery, beginning with her friends and family, but thanks to the good quality of products that she offers and her talent for sales, she soon was able to increase her number of customers.

Elvia is requesting a loan of $250 which will be used for the purchase of merchandise. This will allow her to fulfill the orders she has and continue growing her business. She is committed to returning this quantity in 3 months. She thanks you very much for the opportunity you provide with your support for growing and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Elvia es casada y vive en la localidad de Guadalupe, Nuevo León. Su esposo es maestro, hace cuatro años él sufrió un accidente que le impidió continuar con su trabajo y para poder obtener los recursos que necesitaban Elvia comenzó a vender joyería, inició entre sus conocidos y familiares pero gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y su gusto por las ventas pronto logró incrementar su número de clientes.

Elvia está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, esto le permitirá cubrir los pedidos que tiene y continuar creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de crecer y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
At 45, Siti is still in her 5 year old business which is making wet cakes and sell it. From 03:00 AM Siti started to process the ingredients she bought , so that by sunrise all cakes are ready to be marketed. Those cakes are delivered by Siti to food stalls, and other customers who work with Siti. Siti profitted about RP50,000 ($6)/daily from her business. That profit are used to pay for daily expenses, and some savings for unexpected needs. Siti lives with her husband Abdullah by renting a room for Rp120,000(about $13)/month. In that room Siti processed and market her cakes. From her expertise Siti raised 3 children. Her hope is to move to her own house and to expand her business as her hopes for the future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Diusianya yang ke 45 tahun Siti tetap dengan usahanya yang Ia jalani sejak 5 tahun yang lalu yaitu membuat kue basah dan menjualnya. bahan-bahan yang dibeli oleh Siti mulai diolah pada pukul 03.00 subuh sehingga ketika matahari mulai menampakkan sinarnya semua adonan kue telah siap dipasarkan. Kue-kue tersebut nantinya akan diantar Siti ke warung-warung dan para langganan lainnya yang biasanya bekerjasama dengan Siti. Siti mendapat keuntungan dari usahanya adalah 50.000 rupiah/hari, keuntungan tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiap hari dan sebagian disimpan untuk keperluan yang tidak terduga. Siti tinggal bersama suaminya yang bernama Abdullah dengan mengontrak kos-kosan dengan biaya 120.000 rupiah/bulannya dan ditempat inilah Siti mengolah kue yang dipasarkannya. dengan keahliannya ini Siti mampu membesarkan ketiga anaknya impian untuk mempunyai rumah sendiri dan usaha yang berkembang merupakan harapan Siti dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use:
To buy ingredients to make cake

Membeli bahan-bahan untuk membuat kue

loans.name: Gulkhanim

texts.en: Gulkhanim is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She and her family were relocated to the Ahmadli settlement of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  She is married and has four children.  In 1997 she started selling household items such as small carpets, table covers, etc to overcome the hardships of life as an IDP.  She travels with goods or she receives orders from her clients and takes goods directly to those clients.  She sells goods from her house as well.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She now wants to increase her volume of sales, invest more in her business and increase her income.  She has had two previous loans from Normicro Baku branch.  Now she has applied for a loan of $850 to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy new goods for sale

loans.name: Etih

texts.en: Etih is 31 years old and a mother of one child, aged 12. She sells flavored ice sticks, and can earn US$3 per day. Her husband, A., is a driver who earns US$2 per day. She has to work hard to earn extra income for the family. Etih requests a loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: Teddy, the Group Leader, wants a loan to increase her stock of poultry birds and also build a poultry house.  She wants to buy cows with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To increase the amount of poultry birds and also to build a poultry house

loans.name: Mawero East A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Joan N., the leader of this small group, sells used clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Joan is 26 years old and is married; her husband is a market vendor . Her 3 children, ranging in age from 3 to 7 years, go to school. Each week, Joan makes approximately UGS 70000 (US$40) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to pay school fees for the children. Joan has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGS 300000 (USD$175) to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Joan is joined in her small group by Agatha T. and Oliver N.. Both Agatha T. and Oliver N. sell used clothes and want a loan to expand their businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand a clothing business

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan P., 36, works as a farmer and makes on average around one dollar a day. Her husband is a palm climber, collecting palm juice and refining it to sugar palm. He earns approximately three dollars in revenue. The couple has four children, all of whom are students but also help out on the farm.

This loan will be used to purchase another plot of farmland in order to increase yields and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase another plot of farmland in order to increase yields.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 20 years old and is single. Amina is a fish seller, and she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 30 year old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs, in the town of Borj Barajneh.

Mazen sells natural food. This is the third time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, he wants to buy provisions for his natural food store.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sumadi

texts.id:
Resilient is a good title for Ni Nengah Sumadi, who experienced a loss at her first business loan because 4 of her pigs were infected by some diseases that even killed 1 of the pigs. This misfortune did not kill her spirit to persevere in expanding her business. From the 3 pigs that she had, she could only sell them for $280, which only brought her to a break even point because she spent $25 to buy each pig, and paid $50 for the feed and medicines.

Ni Nengah Sumadi hopes that this second loan can yield a better result. She is determined to learn from her first experience in order to avoid certain pitfalls in her second endeavor in the pig farming business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Tekun dan pantang menyerah, julukan ini cocok di berikan kepada Ni Nengah Sumadi, meski mengalami kerugian pada pinjaman tahap pertama karena 4 ekor ternak babi peliharaannya terserang penyakit, bahkan satu ekor mengalami kematian tak menyurutkan semangatnya untuk tetap bertahan dan kembali mengembangkan usahanya. Dari 3 ekor ternak babi yang tersisa , hanya laku di jual Rp. 2.800.000.- itu berarti hanya kembali modal karena untuk pembelian bibit saja modal yang di keluarkan Rp. 250.000.- ekor sedangkan untuk biaya pakan dan obat mencapai Rp. 500.000.- ekor. Ni Nengah Sumadi sangat berharap pinjaman kedua ini bisa mendapat hasil yang lebih baik dan dia menjadikan pengalaman ini sebagai pelajaran sehingga tak terulang lagi.

loans.use: To buy sow and pig feed

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
This is Justice group. Its leader is Mohamed S.. Other members include: Osman M., Mariatu J., and Mabinty K.. The members of this group are petty traders, selling assorted goods. They have completed repaying their previous loan and are now asking for a new one. They want to be loaned the sum of US$ 1,125. With this, they`ll be able to buy more goods, increase sales and eventually, profit.

Mohamed, the group`s leader, is 45. He was born at Mile 91 about 70 miles outside of Makeni. Mohamed now lives in Makeni, where he does his business. He is married with 4 children. Mohamed has been in his current business for 3 years now.

loans.use: Increase the size of their businesses

loans.name: Dai

texts.vi:
In the years prior to 1990, the financial situation of Ms. D. Thi Dai's family was met with difficulties and hardship. Her children were young and unable to help out the family. She did not farm and did some miscellaneous sales at the market, enough only to feed the family. In 1998 she joined TYM and her first loan was 30.00 USD to raise and sell chicken and raise pigs with average monthly income of 42.00 USD. After 10 years borrowing from TYM, she invested in retail business and raising animals which provided her family with a stable income and greatly improved their livelihood, Presently her family has a house located right on Highway 3 so she opened a shop selling refreshment and repairing cars and motorcycles. She also raises geese and chickens, and no longer has to sell at the market. Her children are now grown and are employed with outside companies. Their family's average monthly income is 605.00 USD and with the loan term of paying weekly, she finds it very agreeable. She herself has always been exemplary in carrying out the stipulations of the fund, and is always eager to assist other women in the group. Thus during her time with the fund, the other women liked and trusted her and elected her into the management group. This time she wishes to borrow 1150.00 USD to invest in a car-cleaning business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Nhung năm 1990 trở về trước kinh tế gia đình chị Đồng Thị Đãi còn gặp nhiều khó khăn, vất vả. Con còn nhỏ chưa giúp được gì cho gia đình, không làm ruộng nên chị đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ kiếm đủ ăn hằng ngày. Năm 1998 chị tham gia quỹ và vay vốn vòng 1 là 500.000 đồng để buôn bán gà thịt và chăn nuôi lợn nái mỗi tháng cũng cho thu nhập khoảng 700.000.đồng. Đến nay qua 10 năm vay vốn từ Quỹ chủ yếu đầu tư vào buôn bán và chăn nuôi kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định, đời sống ngày một nâng cao. Hiện tại gia đình chị có ngôi nhà ngay mặt đường quốc lộ 3 nên chị đã mở cửa hàng bán giải khát và làm dịch vụ rửa xe ô tô, xe máy. Ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi thêm ngan, gà thịt, mà không đi buôn bán ở chợ nữa, các con của chị đã trưởng thành và đi làm công ty. Tổng thu nhập của gia đình chị mỗi tháng khoảng 10.000.000 đ do vậy với cơ chế hoàn trả theo tuần chị thấy rất phù hợp. Bản thân chị luôn gương mẫu thực hiện quy định của Quỹ và sẵn sàng giúp đỡ chị em trong cụm nên trong suốt thời gian tham gia Quỹ chị luôn được chị em tin yêu và bầu vào ban quản lý cụm. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào làm sạch nội thất ô tô.

loans.use: Invest in services clean car

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is married and has 4 children. Gladys sells maize, beans and other food items at Yammoransah on the Cape Coast, which she has done since 1981. Her husband is a farmer. Gladys uses her income to pay for the children's school fees, food, and clothing, as well as the utility bills. Gladys will use the loan to purchase more maize, beans and other food items from the farmers to be sold at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to expand her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more maize, beans and other food items

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, a sus 30 años es madre de 2 hijos que están estudiando y necesitan mucho apoyo, su esposo Omar trabaja en una empresa de su localidad y cuando puede la apoya en su peluquería. En su casa, brinda servicios de corte de cabello, peinados y otros, ya que estudio cosmetología. Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora pues cuando no tiene trabajo en la peluquería se dedica a la venta de productos  de belleza. Ahora quiere implementar y alquilar un local para poner su salón de belleza, así como también mejorar las infraestructuras de su vivienda, por lo que presenta esta solicitud de préstamo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 30-year-old mother of two children who are in school and need a lot of support. Her husband, Omar, works at a local business and when he can helps Mercedes with her beauty shop. At her home, she provides hair-cutting, combing and other services she learned at beauty school. She is a very hard-working women who made a living selling cosmetics before she started working at the salon. Now she wants to expand her business and rent a storefront to setup her beauty shop, as well as make improvements to her home. For this, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a storefront to set up her salon

loans.name: Glendys Melina

texts.es:
La señora Glendys pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertadores Nº 299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de una hija  menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de repuestos. Ya tiene 2 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
 
En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). En las mañanas se dedica de su pequeña hija y en las tardes reparte sus productos a sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1.700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza, colonias de bebe, cremas de cuerpo, etc.   

Glendys agradece a Manuela Ramos porque a su corta edad se ha independizado y ha logrado mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Glendys belongs to the communal bank “Las Siete Estrellas” (“The Seven Stars”), located in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in Ucayali. She is 22 years old, the mother of a young daughter who still depends on her, married, and her husband drives a motokar. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of spare parts. She has been working with the communal bank for two years.

Currently, she sells EBEL beauty products. In the mornings, she cares of her small daughter and in the afternoons she distributes her products to her customers.

With this loan of 1,700.00 soles, to be repaid in six months, she will purchase beauty products, baby colognes, body creams, etc.

Glendys is grateful to Manuela Ramos because, at her young age, she has been able to become independent and managed to improve her financial situation.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase beauty products, baby colognes, body creams, etc.

loans.name: Uriel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Uriel Antonio M. tiene la edad de 33 años,  habita en la Concepción  junto a su esposa y  hijos, uno de ellos trabaja como jardinero para ayudarle con los gastos  al igual que la esposa trabaja como responsable de mantenimiento, para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , Don Uriel desde hace 15 años trabaja como vendedor de frutas en los departamentos y la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento , los sueños de él es llegar a tener una pulpería y a la ves vender sus frutas para mejorar las condiciones de su familia .Este señor solicita la cantidad de C$ 12,000.00 córdobas para  incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Uriel Antonio M. is 33 years old, lives in the town of Concepcion together with his wife and children. One of them works as a gardener to help with the expenses and his wife works in household maintenance. Uriel has been working as a fruit vendor for the past 15 years and the greatest difficulty he has faced is the lack of financing. His dreams are to have grocery store and to also sell his fruits to improve his family's living conditions. He requests a loan amounting to C@12,000 cordobas, which he will use to expand his business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili tiene 34 años, vive con sus 6 hijos. Hace más de un año que se dedica a comprar diversos productos y venderlos en la ciudad de Lima, uno de los productos que vende es queso, que lo compra al por mayor y cada quincena viaja para venderlos en los mercados principales de la capital, de esa manera se genera los recursos económicos suficientes que le permiten sostener a sus 6 hijos, lo admirable es que ella sola es el único sostén para sus hijos, es por ello que los esfuerzos de esta madre son tan necesarios. Es la segunda vez que Lili solicita un préstamo con MFP, y está comprometida en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con este dinero adquirirá más mercadería para aprovechar estas fiestas navideñas, además de comprar quesos al por mayor, también comprará truchas.
texts.en:
Lili is 34 years old, she lives with her 6 children. For more than a year she has been buying different products to sell in the town of Lima. One of the products is cheese which she buys in bulk and every fortnight she travels to sell at the principal markets of the capital and this way obtain sufficient economic resources to support her 6 children. It is to be admired that she is their only means of support and therefore the efforts of this mother are very necessary. This is the second time Lili requests a loan with MFP and she is commited to be punctual with the payments. With the money she will purchase more merchandise to take advantage of the Cristmas season. Apart from buying cheese in bulk she will also purchase trouts.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock to improve sales.

loans.name: Idayyet

texts.en:
Idayyet A. is a hard-working and dedicated businessman, 53 years old. He is married with three children. Idayyet has operated a business selling men's clothing in the central market of Sabirabad for the past 12 years. Idayyet already has enough experience to do his work successfully and has customers who always come to him.

Idayyet wishes his children to get a good education, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. As his children are growing up, their expenses are rising accordingly, so in order to expand his business, Idayyet is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise so he can offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. With the rotation of supplies in his business, he plans to repay the loan within 15 months. The well-being of Idayyet’s family and his business are in your hands. Idayyet and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: purchase more clothing for his inventory to increase profit

loans.name: Beni Group

texts.en:
Béatrice W. is 49 years old and the mother of four children, of whom two are twins. They are aged between 17 and 25. Besides her own children, she also takes care of an orphan aged 17. Three of the children in her care are enrolled in school.

Béatrice began her business in 2004 selling a five-kilo bag of sugar. Her beginning capital was US$ 5. As she used to sell near a garage, she quickly noticed what the mechanics’ needs were. She then catered to their needs by buying and selling peanuts and cakes. Over the months, those mechanics become loyal customers. With hard work and good management, she used her profits to increase her inventory from one five-kilo bag of sugar to ten.

Béatrice joined "Beni", one of Hope’s groups, last September. The two loans she has received have helped her to diversify her business by beginning to sell loaves of bread. Beatrice’s business makes a profit of about US$ 40 per week. Her dream is to open a beverage store and a clothing shop. Beatrice’s strategies are based on keeping up good relationships with her customers and knowing their daily needs.

loans.use: To reinforce the working capital of the various businesses

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Monica de 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo de 17 años, quien le ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, pero a su vez trabaja como secretaria en la municipalidad del distrito donde vive. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás. Y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus productos adecuadamente, además le es muy rentable porque sus principales consumidores son sus compañeros de trabajo y le genera ingresos buenos. Posteriormente quiere tener una tienda de ropa y zapatos. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de prendas para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Monica is a single mother, 48 years old, and lives with her only son, aged 17, who helps her a lot. She sells clothing and shoes, at the same time she works as a secretary in the municipality of her district. She has been in her current sales activity for the past two years. What she enjoys most in her work is selling her products which is very profitable because most of her customers are her co-workers and she makes a good income. Later, she would like to have a store to sell her clothing and shoes. This is her second loan with MFP; she will use the loan to buy a large quantity of clothing to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Salom

texts.ru:
Ниёзов Абдусалом женат, имеет 1 дочь. В этом году у него дела идут не так хорошо, как он планировал. А он должен дочь выдать замуж , приданное надо ей готовить. Он решил получить кредит , что бы отремонтировать машину и ездить на ней как маршрутное такси . Он переоборудует машину на газ и она будет ездить не на бензине а на газе. Газ дешевле чем бензин, поэтому он считает что это выгодно. 
Его жена тоже работает, она  продает пирожки на улице. Дочь учиться в университете, а также она ходит учиться на швею , что бы в будущем помогать родителям и стать хорошей портной.
texts.en:
Salom N. is married and has 1 daughter. This year he is not doing as well as he planned, but he needs to marry off his daughter and needs to prepare a dowry for her. He decided to take out a loan to repair his car and to drive it like a taxi with a fixed route. He is planning to convert the car so that it runs on gas and the car will run on gas instead of on gasoline. Gas is cheaper than gasoline, this is why he thinks this would be profitable. His wife also works, she sells pastries on the street. His daughter studies at the university, she is also learning to be a seamstress, so that she can help her parents in the future and to become a good tailor.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert automobile

loans.name: Jerjes

texts.en: Jerges is a 48-year-old single man living in A. Mansoura in Bekaa valley. He has owned a mini market for 14 years, which serves the nearby areas. Jerges wants to borrow $1,000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his mini market business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Mrs. Leonora E., 47 years old, is married and blessed with five children. One of them is already married and four are still studying.

Leonora is a member of good standing of PAGLAUM COOP under its PDPLP program. She is a good member because she has never committed a default of her weekly obligation. Now she has obtained a loan of Php 6,000 as additional capital for her proposed project which is rice production.

Leonora tries to cope up with her obligations like savings, CBU (Capital Build Up) and insurance, hoping that it will give the best return in the future and also to their children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her proposed rice-growing business

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en:
Bùi Thị M. (1706060140), a 41-year-old married mother of two school-aged children living in the town of Quảng Xương, owns and operates a general store. Her main but not exclusive source of income from the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products to the local community. Mrs. M. just started operating this store and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from it.

In 2006, she joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to purchase breeding livestock. Mrs. M. is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 9000000 VND which will be used to invest in the store, and plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.en:
Mr. Nicolás is a 43-year-old businessman married to Mrs. Mirta, who is 34 years old, and with whom he has four children: Ana who is 14; Liz who is 12; Rossana who is 11; and Richard who is 9. 

All of their children are continuing their studies thanks to the efforts of their parents who work daily to bring up the family, as they, themselves, did not have the opportunity to study.

Nicolás has a small grocery store, which he runs out of his home, and currently generates good earnings. He started this activity in 2004. At the beginning it was difficult because he needed capital to work, and with his children it was even harder. 

With much effort and with the help of his family, the business was able to continue ahead, and today it is a well-supported business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, meat, noodles, beer, sodas, deli meats, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Famodu

texts.en: B. styles hair and sells hair styling items. She opened her shop seven years ago after training for two years. She needs a loan of N70,000 to purchase a dryer and hair extensions to sell. B. is 31 years old. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer and hair extensions

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario nueva luz esta ubicado en la aldea coyolito a 100 metros al este de la lonja, y esta formado por tres miembros, ellos se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo.
 
las actividades que realizan cada uno son las siguientes:
el señor fidel C. R. tiene 26 años de edad y esta casado con la señora edit xiomara G., tienen dos hijos una niña pequeña y un varon que esta en la escuela.
ella se dedica a cuidar los niños y el se dedica al negocio de compra venta de pescado y camarones, su casa es de madera a la orilla del mar.
necesita el prestamo para invertirlo en compra de pescado blanco, pescado rojo y pescado babosa.
 
la sra patrocinia del carmen D. tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en la
aldea del tular abajo. se dedica a la compra venta de pescado que lo vende en la zona, tambien le ayuda la nuera a vender en la comunidad y fuera de la zona necesita el crédito para comprar mas pescado y asi tener mayor utilidad.

la sra. mirian griselda G. tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos su esposo se llama hector ulices rivas, se dedica a la venta de frescos y golosinas, necesita el prestamo para comprar mas refrescos para surtir el negocio.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Nueva Luz is located in the village Coyolito, 100 meters east of the fish market. It is made up of three members, who have known each other for a long time.

The activities that they each do are the following: Sr. Fidel C. R. is 26 years old, and is married to Sra. Edit Xiomara G.. They have 2 children, a little girl and a son who is in school. She takes care of the children, and he is a dealer of fish and prawns. Their house is made of wood, and is at the sea shore. They need the loan to invest in the purchase of white fish, red fish, and babosa fish.

Sra. Patrocinia del Carmen D. is 36 years old, and is a single mother. She lives in the village of Tular Abajo. She is a fish dealer and she sells fish in the region. She also she helps her daughter-in-law sell in the community and outside of the region. She needs the loan to buy more fish and therefore have higher profits.

Sra. Mirian Griselda G. is 23 years old, is married, and has two children. Her husband´s name is Hector Ulices Rivas. She sells soft drinks and candy. She needs the loan to buy more soft drinks to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish, prawns, and soft drinks

loans.name: Bulgantamir

texts.en:
Z. Bulgantamir, 44, is a single mother who has twin girls aged 11. Both her children are attending a local elementary school.

In 1999 Bulgantamir started running a retail business selling sheep, goat and cow organs at the local butcher shop. Her two friends have helped her very much to start the business. As a result of Bulgantamir's 10 years of hard work, her inventory has increased from 400,000 tugrugs to 4,000,000 tugrugs (1 USD=1450 MNT).

During the last few years, Bulgantamir has been purchasing whole animal carcasses at wholesale prices then cutting them up to resell at retail prices. With the profit, she bought a plot of land four years ago. Last year she built a small house on the plot of land she owns.

During the interview, Bulgantamir said that "I'm working hard for my daughters' future prospects. My hope is to let them enroll in university and provide financial support for them to pay their tuition."

With this loan, Bulgantamir will buy whole animal carcasses for her business.

loans.use: To buy whole animal carcasses for her business

loans.name: Kenedy Group

texts.es: El grupo comunal “Kenedy” esta representado por la señora Matilde y conformado por 13 miembros de los cuales gran mayoría del grupo ya trabajaron bajo esta modalidad de crédito solidario. Las socias se dedican a venta de comida, venta de refrescos, pastillas, venta de ropa, los varones se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group named "Kenedy" is represented by Matilde and it is composed of 13 members, most of whom have previously worked with a loan system. The members are involved in sales of products such as prepared foods, soft drink sales, baked goods, and clothing. The men provide public transportation. The competition they face is considerable but the members have a great deal of experience and know how to prosper their businesses, offering a variety of high quality products. The loan they are requesting is to be used as working capital to invest in their small businesses, and to increase their earnings. This translates into a better quality of life for their family, improving more and more every day. They are very grateful for the trust that has been placed in them and they are even more motivated to work hard. The members are currently in their first loan cycle but they have previous group experience. They promise to give all that they have to prospoer responsibly and together as a team.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bengoma #1 Group

texts.en:
Bengoma #1 is a group of five borrowers, led by Makula D., who is living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Makula is 36 years old with three children, aged two to nine years old.  Currently, the nine year-old is in 2nd grade. She is Muslim and is from Guinea where schools at the time were not available for girls. Thus, she is illiterate. Makula's husband is a fisherman but doesn’t earn enough to support the family.  She now lives in nearby Borkeza Town in a refugee camp because the town was burned to the ground during the war.  

Makula’s business consists of selling fish wholesale in the market in a stall alongside approximately 10 other vendors.  She has been running her business for three years.  In the dry season, fish are plentiful so she sells her husband’s catch, but in the rainy season she needs to purchase fish wholesale to sell in the market.  She is requesting a loan for this fish purchase and also to buy additional baskets and bags to transport them.  She is successful because her customers like the way she prepares her fish for consumption.  Her dream is to grow her business to be a year-long business, unlike those who go out of business during the rainy season.  With the profits from her business, Makula dreams of building a permanent shop for her year-round business, sending her children to school, and building a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish and to buy baskets for transporting them

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
“Time is gold!”, says Marcela E.. She is a young mother who lives in Barangay Labni, Mabuslo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She was only 16 years old when she got married to Erwin and they now have three children. Despite the hardships of life, they are doing their best and never lose hope for the future of their children.

Marcela's husband is working abroad, while Marcela manages a business buying and selling vegetables in their village. She also sells food snacks to bring in more income. Every week she has a gross income of PHP 1,150 which she uses for their daily needs and for the education of their eldest child. They want their children to be successful someday and are giving them the education they need. Because of her interest in improving and strengthening her business, Marcela would like to borrow PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders as additional business capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mrs. Ban T. is a villager in Sisla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Aside from this farming, she is a pig breeder. In farming plantation, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive and she will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to feed her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Nhen Trai, is a rice wine maker in the local village. Mrs. Ban T. is 39 years old and the mother of four children four of whom are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine U. is 33 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Nyarugenge district outside of Kigali, where she owns her restaurant and drinking establishment – recently opened, just last year. Martine employs four persons from her community in her popular gathering spot, which is open every day from 8AM to 10 PM.

Martine is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to provide needed working capital reserves for her business, which will allow her to purchase sufficient inventory and supplies, which will help her to have a more successful enterprise.

loans.use: Working Capital and Inventory/Foodstuffs

loans.name: Can Wange Pe Aber Gifter Group

texts.en:
A. Gifter is a business lady, twenty six years old, who is married with two children, both schooling. She also has three dependents who are schooling, too.

Gifter has carried out her tailoring services business so far for three years. She is requesting the loan to add capital to her business stock by purchasing clothing material for making designs.

Gifter is an encouraging businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a screen and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchasing clothing material for making designs

loans.name: Noly

texts.en:
Noly D. is a young and strong 60-year-old who loves running her business and is happy to be earning a daily income from her business operations. She lives in the village of Brgy. 111, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is married to a motorcycle driver and they have three children who are between 21 and 30 years old. Noly has always dreamed of a more comfortable life for herself and her family.

She had to do something to help her husband earn a living because his income from driving a motorcycle, shuttling passengers, was just not sufficient to sustain their family. So Noly started her own eatery, offering different kinds of food to her regular customers. In spite of the small income she earned from this business, she persisted because it helped their food needs.

To improve her business and be able to earn a bigger income, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 2001. With the additional capital from her loans, she was soon able to expand her business to include a general store. She has been in business for over 25 years already, but it is only now with the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon that she is finally achieving some success in her business. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000 from her business operations, allowing her to set aside some savings for their future.

In her previous loan, she borrowed Php 17,000 and used it as working capital for her eatery and to buy more stock for her general store. Even at her age, she maintains her good credit performance by paying her loan in full and on time without any delays. Now she is borrowing for her 16th cycle loan, the same amount of Php 17,000 to be used to buy motorcycle spare parts to repair her husband's source of his livelihood and also as additional capital for her general store and eatery.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her husband's motorcycle and as additional capital for her eatery and general store

loans.name: Toki

texts.en:
Toki B. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Toki is 30 years old and is married to an engineer. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and her husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the local people. Hanna is a trader. She trades in second hand footwear for both males and females. She buys the goods from Accra and sells by hawking in her community. Hanna also treks to sell in nearby communities. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to purchase her goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy footwear, in bulk.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret S. (pictured here), 42, and her husband, Mr. Vong Oun, 43, have been married since 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are attending school. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saret has been growing corn, tomato and papaya for 30 years, while her husband has been a house builder for 20 years. Saret doesn’t have enough capital to maintain her farm, so she is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticides

loans.name: Marcilisa

texts.en:
Marcilisa L. is from the village of Tugas, Baliangao Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 53 years old, married, and has 8 adult-age children. To earn a living, Marcilisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. More specifically, she is engaged in banana production and hog raising. Marcilisa has been in this line of business for 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP ($125) per month on account of these activities.

In 2000, Marcilisa joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and to improve her standard of living. Notably, Marcilisa has already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marcilisa is now requesting another loan, also in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to expand her operations.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-lending model.

loans.use: To expand and improve her banana/hog-raising business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres  y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 21 años y es madre de 01 bebe  que aun dependen de ella. La Socia presenta Estudios de Secundaria Completa.

Teresa, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, lleva poco tiempo en el negocio, que hoy en la actualidad le esta dando muy buenos resultados,  se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. 

Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de  S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles  iniciándose  con 03  paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo más. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles comprará más bebidas gasificadas  como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Teresita como le dicen de cariño, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así, su sueño es surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the “Honestidad y Trabajo” ("Honesty and Work") Community Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, Departament of San Martín, Peru. She is a 21-year-old single mother with one baby and has a high school education. Teresa is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life and has a strong desire to make headway. Currently, she makes a living selling soft drinks, which she has only been doing for a short amount of time but is delivering very good results. Teresa feels very pleased with what she has achieved. She works in a well-conditioned environment out of her own home and tends to her customers with the kindness and charisma that she is known for. She administers the business without a schedule or boss. She tells us she started out with a small loan of 300 soles, which she used to buy three cases of soft drinks. She saw that things went very well, and little by little she was able to invest more. With the current loan of 1,500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more cases of drinks of different flavors, sizes and brands as well as mineral water both carbonated and non-carbonated. Teresa is very grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she most needed it, and she is responsible with her repayments and plans to continue to be so. Her dream is to better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cases of soft drinks of different flavors, sizes and brands

loans.name: Ador

texts.en:
Ador A. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 56 years old. Ador is married and has 4 adult children.  Ador operates a family member's taxi business.
