The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services through a "habal-habal" to the local community (a habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers).  Ador has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $65) for these activities.

In 2010, Ador joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. Ador is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan Ador has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 50 year old lady who has been running a boutique for four years.  She used to farm together with her husband who is also a businessman before she started her own business.    She has been a member of Faulu Kenya and she has previously taken five loans from the MFI.   She used these loans to buy a plot and another to buy a farm.  She plans to buy clothes, necklaces, shoes and ladies tops hence she has requested for a loan of Kes.50,000.  She hopes to buy a taxi, buy a plot to build her own house and expand her business in the future.  She also dreams buying a lorry in ten years time.  Rose has three children who she has seen through school.

loans.use: To buy clothes, necklaces, shoes and ladies tops

loans.name: Masolidi Nansubuga Rachael Group

texts.en:
N. Rachael is a hardworking business lady who is twenty-five years old.  She is married with three children, of whom two are going to school. 

She has been in the poultry business since the year 2006. She is using the loan to purchase feed, drugs, chicks, and so forth for her poultry business. She is a promising lady whose dream or future plan is to obtain a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase feed, drugs, chicks, and so forth for her poultry business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 49 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su querida hija Yusely de 16 años, quien es su principal apoyo a la hora de trabajar en la chacra y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Delia tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, junto a la más joven de sus hijas trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas y habas, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelamente a esta actividad, tiene una tienda, en donde abastece de víveres a todo su poblado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como crecen sus plantaciones. Es así que lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus sembríos, puesto que los químicos que utiliza para eliminar a las plagas, son altamente dañinos para su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar su producción. Este es segundo crédito con MFP; en su primer crédito fue muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En tanto, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras.
Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras, así como también productos de primera necesidad para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old, mother to a very happy and loving family, who lives in her own home with her dear daughter Yusely who is 16 years old. Yusely is her main help when working on the farm and what she wants most is to improve Yusely's quality of life.

The arduous work days that Delia spends on the farm have improved their crops and made their land more productive. Alongside of the youngest of her daughters she works from very early in the morning, growing potatoes and beans, products that they will then sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. In addition to this job, she has a store where she sells foodstuffs to the people of her village. What she enjoys most about her job is sowing the land and watching her crops grow. She has been working in the fields for thirty years and thinks the hardest part is having to spray the crops, since the pesticides are highly damaging to your health.

With time she would like to be able to buy more land and increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP; with her first loan she was very punctual with her payments and hopes to be this time as well. In her village bank she is known as a very cheerful member, beloved by the rest of her group. With the 100 nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will buy fertilizer for her farm as well as food staples to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fertilizer and staples for her store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan D. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental Province. She is 49 years old. Susan is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from her "alacarte": selling grilled chicken and pork in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which, will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be Susan's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lal Gul

texts.en:
Lal Gul, the son of S., is a resident of the 16th district, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 years old, married and the father of four children who are all school students. He has a shop where he sells electrical materials like bulbs, power cords, tube lights, etc.

He needs the Kiva loan to purchase more electrical equipment for his shop to attract more clients and to increase his income. He is confident that he will make his repayments on time and that he will join for a second loan cycle so he can progress more.

loans.use: To purchase electrical equipment to sell

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en: Cesaria A. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Cesaria owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other food delicacies in the local community. Cesaria has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Cesaria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cesaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cesaria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cesaria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida S. lives with her husband and children in Multan, the city of sweetmeats and clothes in Pakistan. She financially supports her husband by selling clothes and doing sewing. She takes orders from her neighbors


She wants to purchase another sewing machine; she will also hire a helper who will help her to complete larger orders on time. She has applied for a loan for that purpose. 



She hopes that growing her business will increase her income and enable her family to have a better life. 

Note: "Shahida is showing her clothes in this picture".

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Octavio Federico

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Octavio; El socio tiene 48 años de edad el socio es casado tiene 2 hijos, Él trabaja en la telefónica es la empresa que presta servicios telefónicos, él socio también alterna este su trabajo con la artesanía, El socio tiene en su casa un pequeño taller de artesanía, aquí el socio se relaja y le encanta elaborar diferentes objetos. Él socio descubrió su pasión cuando vió en su hijo el amor a este elemento que es la arcilla, el empezó también a descubrir que esto lo relajaba y que era bueno haciendo objetos de decoración, él socio vende su trabajo y está cada día más convencido de que este negocio crecerá.  El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de artesanía.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Octavio is a member of the Communal Bank “Qorichuspa”. He lives in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

Sr. Octavio is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He works for Telefónica, a company that provides phone services. In addition, he spends parts of his time making handicrafts. Octavio has a small craft shop in his house where he enjoys making different objects as a way of helping him to relax. Octavio discovered his passion after seeing his son work with clay. He found that making decorations was a good way to relax. Upon selling his works, he was convinced that his business would grow. He is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for manufacturing his crafts.

Octavio infinitely values and appreciates the loan that was provided, since this will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. He promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making handicrafts

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a single mother of two children and her children go to school.  She also takes care of her mother and her grand children. She owns a stall in Kalerwe market selling second hand clothes.  Kasifa wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes.   She buys bales of clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and uses public transport to and from shopping.    She has been in this clothing business for ten years.  Besides this clothing business she sells piped water from her home.   

Kasifa stays in Mulago Zone in Kawempe Division and works six days a week.  Her business challenges include transportation and defaulters.  She aspires to buy a plot of land.  She decides to join MCD T to acquire enough capital  for her clothing business.  Kasifa resides in and owns a four roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expense includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en:
Myagmarjav J. is 52 years old and lives with her husband in Hentiy province, eastern Mongolia. All her children have been living separately from their parents.  Her husband helps Myagmarjav with her business, where she sews ger (traditional Mongolian housing tent) covers and other items. She started her business in 2009 by hand-making all of her products.

Myagmarjav has gained many years of sewing experience since she used to work as a seamstress for a local company. Her main products are ger covers made of canvas and tarpaulin cotton.  Myagmarjav sells them out of a local market in her town. Her business is advantageous and beneficial because there are not many similar business owners in her town. "I had been working under the supervision of someone else for many years, but now I am feeling happy that I am working and earning for myself," she says.

Myagmarjav is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase materials which can be used to help her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Gloria is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seafood to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace V. is 33 years old, married and from the village of Parog Parog within the municipality of Solana, Cagayan province on the Luzon islands. To make a living, Grace raises pigs for breeding. Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Grace joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. Grace is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use all additional revenue generated from the business to support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a 29-year-old married mother of two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and Mahbuba started her business seven years ago in order to support her family. 

All year she sells fruits that she buys from local farmers. Twice a week, Mahbuba travels over 20 km to sell her produce for attractive prices at the busy market. With the loan of 5,000 TJS from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her selling goods and to buy more fruits for selling.

Mahbuba strives to give her children a better life than they have, including supporting them through a good education. Mahbuba is a well spoken, friendly businesswoman who is worthy of the support of Kiva partners.   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits for selling

loans.name: Isabel Antonio

texts.pt:
Isabel Antônio M. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, solteira e ainda não tem filhos. Não estudou porque os pais na altura priorizaram as atividades agrícolas e pastagem de gado bovino para garantirem o sustento da família. Vive na casa própria e sustenta seu sobrinho de 3 anos de idade que vive com ele. 

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo com os seus pais quando estes vinham atrás de um emprego. Trabalha numa empresa de produção e venda de banana ha mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salario de 1.770.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que já se beneficiaram de serviços desta instituição. Este é o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, pedra, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir e mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Isabel Antônio M. was born in the District of Manjacaze, Province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique.  She is single and has no children.  She didn't attend school because at that point her parents made agricultural activities and raising cattle a priority to ensure the maintenance of the family.  She lives in her own house and supports her three-year-old nephew, who lives with her.

She left Gaza for Maputo with her parents when they came for employment.  She has worked in a factory and sold bananas for over five years.  She has no employees, and has a salary of 1,770 MT per month, which she uses for household expenses and still sets some aside now and then in her bank account.

She has never had a loan from another bank and got to know about Hluvuku through colleagues who already benefit from the services of this institution.  This is her first loan — at a value of 10,000 MT — with which she intends to purchase construction materials (cement, beams, stone, sand, corrugated metal, and other items) in order continue with the construction of her house.

She is confident that she will repay without any problem and will ask for a new loan to finish construction and furnish her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, beams, stone, sand, corrugated metal, and other items)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. lives in the Wandegeya Katanga neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, one of whom is in school. Esther has a business of a bar. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Esther sells her products from home, by means of retail.  Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer, soda, and jerrycans of local gin.

The main business challenge(s) for Esther include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers being able to reach her business.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house, own a delivery van and start selling wholesale only. Esther lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda and jerry cans of local gin.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert N. is 25 years old. He is single and without any kids of his own to support.   Robert is a farmer and has been farming on his own piece of land for the last five years.
	
He learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET-registered client in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning spend to buy seeds, fertilizer and chemicals for his wheat farm. 

He is anticipating buying some farm machineries with the anticipated profit from the expanded farming activity, and improving his living standards.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, sprays and fertilizers for wheat farm.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius N., aged 39, is a livestock trader at Bissil Market, a busy market in Kajiado.  He is married to Itayo, a farmer who is 30 years old.  The couple has one child, Matthew, who is 14 years old and in school.  Julius has been running his livestock trading business for four years, with a monthly profit of 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD. by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.  He has applied for a loan that he will use to buy livestock for trading.  If the loan boosts his business, he will open a butchery so he can also target individual customers buying meat for home use.  This will enable him to support his son to a higher level of education.

Julius’s dream is to become a famous businessman.

loans.use: To buy livestock for trading

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives with her family in a two room brick house in Okara, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan.  She operates a sewing business.  Razia receives orders from her neighborhoods, and in her six years of experience, she has never received a complaint from her customers about her work.  

She is a widow with three children.  Her elder daughter also sews to help her complete her orders.  Another daughter is a school teacher and her son is a supervisor in a rice mill.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine.  Her old machine doesn’t produce a quality product and it takes too  much time to sew a dress.
 
Razia is hopeful that a loan will be profitable for her business, that will resulted in a better financial life for her family.  This is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: María Floricelda

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Marina es socio fundadoras del banco Comunal y le gusta porque las socias son muy cumplidas, ella se desempeña como tesorera función que cumple muy bien ya que es por el bien del grupo. Tiene 40 años de edad, mantienen una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años. Su marido trabaja en una camaronera.

Tiene una mini tienda de abarrotes en su casa, vende desde arroz, azúcar, también vende carne, pescado camarón, queso, ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 18h00.  También vende aguas, colas y helados. Los productos los compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, y otros productos.  Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y poder estudiar y terminar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'La Unión Hace la Fuerza' (Unity is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents make which are known throughout the country.

Marina is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the members are very punctual.  Marina is the bank's treasurer.  She does her job very well since it is for the good of the group.  Marina is 40 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has a 3 year-old son.  Her husband works in a seafood restaurant.

Marina has a small grocery store in her home.  She sells products such as rice, sugar and also meat, fish, prawns, cheese, some medicines and other articles.  She works every day from 6.00am to 6.00pm.  She also sells water, coke and iced treats.  She buys some of her products in the city of Portoviejo and others are delivered direct to her premises.

Marina will use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents and other products.  Her dreams are to have a bigger store and to be able to study for a career.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Raul

texts.es:
Carlos Raul A. C. tiene 34 años de edad, Es casado vive con  la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Moncache Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Carlos Raul se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Carlos Raul A. C. is 34 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Moncache, in Ríos province.

The members of the October 27th rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Santa Sofía.  All of the group's members work in short-cycle agriculture, and in particular, they plant corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Carlos Raul plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He buys products in the Briones market and sells what he produces in the Vaca y Garcia market.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  With the economic support provided by this loan, he will be able to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as the changing climate.  His dream is to buy a house and his own plot of land.

He likes sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo S. is from the village of Margos Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 58 years old. Leo is single. To make a living, Leo owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. Leo is just starting this business.

In 2011, Leo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma E. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Oguis, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by fattening pigs and with an abaca [fiber from abaca palm leaf] weaving business. Her husband, Eduardo E., age 53, works as a construction worker and also helps with his wife's business. They have three children who are 11 to 16 years old. One has a family while the other two are going to school. Delma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Delma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase feed and vitamins so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Delma E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Gisela Veronica

texts.es:
Gisela de 29 años de edad, reside en Chinameca departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre y hermanos, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, el cual depende económicamente de ella.
Ella es empleada de la Alcaldía municipal  de Chinameca desde hace 2 años, laborando de lunes a viernes con un cargo de auxiliar de registro familiar. Por el momento desea mejorar la condición actual del techo de su vivienda y solicita un préstamo para comprar todo lo necesario en materiales como: láminas, clavos, madera, pintura, con estos materiales llevara a cabo la remodelación del techo.
Con esta inversión ayudara a su familia para que estén en un lugar más seguro y gocen de una mejora calidad de vida. Las aspiraciones de Gisela es cuidar su empleo y realizarlo cada día mejor, ya que de ahí depende su hijo a quien quiere apoyar en lo necesario y también ella quiere terminar su carrera universitaria en Administración de Empresas.
texts.en:
Gisela is 29 years old and lives in Chinameca, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her mother and her siblings. She has an 8-year-old son who is economically dependent on her. 

She has been an employee of the Municipality of Chinameca for 2 years, working from Monday to Friday in the position of assistant in the civil registry. At present, she would like to improve the current condition of the roof of her home, and she is requesting a loan to buy all of the necessary materials, such as shingles, nails, wood, and paint. With these materials, she will be able to renovate the roof. 

With this investment, she will help her family, because they will be in a more secure home and will enjoy a better quality of life. Gisela's aspirations are to keep her job and do her work better every day, since her son depends on her support, and she wants to provide him with everything he needs. She would also like to finish her university studies in Business Administration.

loans.use: Buying materials to repair her roof: shingles, nails, wood and paint

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to solve her problems and have a good life

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en:
Nandintsetseg, 23, is married and lives with her husband and a 3-year-old son in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Nandintsetseg's husband works as a welder and gets paid 300,000 MNT monthly.

Nandintsetseg began operating a clothing sales business in 2007 after she graduated from high school in 2006. In addition to her clothing business, she participates in every kind of social activity. Nandintsetseg rents a stall at a local market and she wants to enlarge it by expanding her business. She is a hardworking person who says, "I would like to have my own container which I can operate as a clothing store in the future." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 41 years old, married and the father of five children, aged 13 to 3 years. He has one other dependent and lives in Hioma, Uganda.  

He longs to educate his children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification, and the responsibility rests on him alone.

For 10 years he has been running a carpentry shop, and the business has been very lucrative. 

He faces a challenge of irregular power supply, which hinders his activities. In the future, he wants to have a big carpentry shop with a showroom.

Jackson needs the loan to buy timber, cushion covers and mattresses to use in the workshop.

loans.use: to pay for timber, cushion covers and mattresses to use in the workshop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 57-year-old farmer who is originally from Semarang, Central Java, which is another province in Indonesia. Esther is married to Hengky who is 63 years old.  They are blessed with five children: Romy, 37 years old, Ray, 35 years old, Roy, 32 years old, Rio, 30 years old; and Rini, 22 years old. All of her sons are married; Rini just graduated from the University.

Esther has been running a piglet breeding business for eight months. She commenced her business by purchasing two piglets to raise and breed. Now she has two pigs and nine piglets. She used to have 11 piglets but due to disease, she lost two piglets. Losing two piglets cannot prevent Esther from running this business. Esther plans to buy more piglets to fatten. She can sell them when they reach a standard weight. Esther likes the piglet breeding business because it can generate a good profit for her and her family as well.

Esther is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to purchase four piglets and fodder. Esther really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business. She believes the loan will motivate her to go forward.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: David Armando

texts.es:
David de 27 años, es un hombre que inpira mucho en su familia. Trabaja para una empresa como maestro albañil, poco a poco a reunido dinero para construir mejor su casa y darle una buena vida a sus hijos. 

El labora diariamente para poder mantener a su familia. Su esposa es empleada domestica. Tienen un hijo de ocho años que todavia estudia. Con el prestamo quieres comprar materiales de construccion para terminar de construir su vivienda y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
David is 27 years old.  He is a man who is inspired by his family.  He works for a business as a master bricklayer.  Slowly, he has saved money to improve the construction of his house and give his children a better life.

He works every day to support his family.  His wife works as a housekeeper.  He has an 8 year old son who is still studying.  

With this loan, he wants to purchase construction materials to finish building his house and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado G. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old. Conrado is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Conrado owns & operates a pedicab transport service. Conrado has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Conrado joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conrado is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase a new motorcycle for transport services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conrado from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Karina Patricia

texts.es:
Karina Patricia tiene 25 años, es soltera vive  con los padres en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar no tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Karina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ser una profesiona y comprar un carro para los padres.

Le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Karina Patricia is 25 years old, single, has no children and lives with her parents in the Chillanes neighborhood, province of Bolívar.

The V.R.C. COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel Communal Bank is located in the Pailaloma area some 60 minutes from the office in the Chillanes neighborhood. The Bank is made up of 13 members who are in agriculture; they grow corn, potatoes and wheat.

Karina is a farmer; she grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. She buys her products in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month and later sells them in the Sunday market of Chillanes.

Karina needs the loan to buy materials for her crops as well as fertilizers and manure. The loan will help her economically to meet her needs and increase her production as she fights plagues, diseases and the change in climate that affects her crops. Karina’s dream is to be a professional and buy her parents a car.

Karina enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: buy materials for her crops as well as fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Vepkhia

texts.en:
Vepkhia comes from the village of Vartsikhe in the Imereti District of West Georgia. He is 40 years old and lives in the village with his 80-year-old mother, 16-year-old son, and 13-year-old daughter. The children all go to school. 

Vepkhia has four milk cows and three calves. He produces traditional Georgian cheese and sells it at the local open market. Also he has two greenhouses, where greens and tomatoes are grown. Vepkhia sells them at the open market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is approximately 500 Laris, including the pension of Vepkhia's mother. 

With the requested loan Vepkhia plans to construct a third greenhouse for growing greens and tomatoes. It will increase the amount of his harvest and thus the income from sales by 30%. The increased income will allow the family to improve their living conditions, through purchasing new household goods, as well as to finance the education of their children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul, 56, is a member of this group. She is the resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in the Isykul region. She has a husband who is a pensioner. Together they bring up a sixteen year old son who studies at school. 

Baktygul works as a cleaner. Her monthly salary is 2500 soms. Three years ago her son suggested that she apply for a loan to purchase livestock. She got a loan in the amount of 10000 soms and used that money efficiently. She repaid the loan successfully and now she hopes to get another loan. The purpose of the loan is to purchase four livestock animals for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende tomates, zanahorias, cebollas, lechugas y pepinos, la socia vende las verduras en el mercado desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana, 28, is a member of the “El Diamante de Urubamba” (Urubamba’s Diamond) communal bank located in Urubamba District, Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily chores with selling vegetables.  She sells tomatoes, carrots, onions, lettuce and cucumbers.  She sells her vegetables in the market from 7am until 4pm.  Through this business she’s able to support her son.  She wants to expand the vegetable selling business and is asking for a loan to buy vegetables at wholesale.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Mirazol

texts.en:
Mirazol is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Mirazol has a retail shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more bananas and coconuts to sell.

Mirazol is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mirazol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Raihon

texts.en:
Raihon is a hardworking woman and the loving mother of seven children. Her husband works in Russia and only she is a breadwinner for her family. Raihon is engaged in a farming business and she has been in this business for a year. She cultivates wheat and corn and she always hopes that her crops will give a good harvest. For this reason, Raihon would like a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants in order to get a good harvest and profit.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a wall with concrete and wood.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 40 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Celina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase or order for more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the "Tawopaneh" group. They have small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu. Kadiatu is 44; she was born in Port Loko  but she is currently residing in Magburaka, together with her husband and six children. Her husband is a salaried worker, five of her children are attending secondary school, and one is in college. 

For eight years now, Kadiatu has been selling ready-to-wear clothes, shoes, underwear, etc. With this loan, she will buy ready-to-wear clothes, shoes, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes, shoes, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.

Celso has a pigpen and sells matured, grown pigs. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for pigs.

Celso is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Celso hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Erenia is 52 years old and married. She has eight children.

Erenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Erenia has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Erenia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира замужем имеет троих детей. Она и ее муж являются преподавателями. Она преподаватель немецкого языка. Заработная плата у учителя маленькая и она не хватает на содержание семьи. Для этого она вместе с мужем занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. Полученный доход они тратят как дополнительные средства для улучшения благосостояния семьи. Она хочет получить кредит и купить крупный рогатый скот для откорма и дальнейшей продажи. Она надеется получить займ в целях получения дохода от бизнеса.
texts.en: Munira is married and has three children. Both she and her husband are teachers; she teaches german. Teachers have a small salary and it's not enough to support a family. So, in order to generate some additional income, they breed large cattle. They spend the money on increasing their standard of living. Munira is asking for a loan to buy some cattle for fattening and breeding. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase their profits.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Guljakan's Group

texts.en:
Guljakan is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a shepherd. This brave woman has raised five daughters and a son. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Guljakan owns 2.5 hectares of land, where she grows wheat. From time to time, she sells some part of the harvest to meet the family needs. With money received from the loan, Guljakan wants to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock, which they breed and resell at a higher price after fattening. In the future, she wishes to leave a good inheritance to her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Romulo pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y las reuniones de los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Romulo tiene 36 años de edad y está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Salvación y donde realiza todas sus actividades económicas. 

Romulo es técnico en contabilidad y trabaja en la sub región del departamento de Madre de Dios en el área de contabilidad, él y su esposa tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en venta de comestibles para eso tienen una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Romulo requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, aceite, fideos y otras cosas más. 
 
Romulo agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Romulo is a member of the 'Del Futuro del Manu' community bank.  The bank's meetings take place once a month in the city of Salvación, in Manu province, in Madre de Dios department.

Romulo is 36 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship.  He was born in the city of Salvación and this is where he carries out all his business activities.

Romulo is an accountant and works in the sub-region of Madre de Dios department in the field of accountancy.  He and his wife have a family business selling groceries.  They have a grocery store located in their home.  He has been in his business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.

On this occasion, Romulo needs a loan to buy merchandise such as bags of sugar, bags of rice, oil, noodles, etc.

Romulo is grateful for this loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bags of sugar, bags of rice, oil, noodles, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Felimon

texts.es: Felimón de 21 años de edad, es soltero. Vive en el centro poblado de Puerto Mayo del distrito de Pichari. Felimón, Durante sus años de adolescencia, se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, ayudando a sus padres en tiempos de sembrio y cosecha,  Es por ello que no se arrepiente de nada por haber elegido la actividad agrícola como su labor, es mas se siente feliz con el trabajo que realiza, ya que le va muy bien en la producción de cacao. Asimismo cuenta con una extensión de café y este año recogió lo primeros frutos. Felimon agradece a sus padres por apoyarlo constantemente en el trabajo, en un futuro piensa continuar con sus estudios superiores. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará insecticidas ya que sus plantaciones fueron afectados por hormigueros, asimismo contratará peones para realizar la poda de su parcela de café.
texts.en:
Felimón, 21, is single.  He lives in the Puerto Mayo settlement in Pichari District.  Felimón spent his adolescence helping his parents do farming chores especially during planting and harvesting.  Because of that, he does not regret having chosen agriculture as his occupation.  What’s more, he feels happy with the work he does because he does very well with his cocoa bean production.  

He also has a field planted with coffee and this year he had his first harvest.  Felimón is grateful to his parents for constantly supporting his work. In future, he plans to continue with his higher education.

This will be his second MFP loan and once again he commits to punctually make his payments.  He will use the 2000 new soles to buy insecticides because his plants were affected by ants; he will also hire day laborers to do the pruning of his coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and to hire day laborers to prune the coffee plants.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.es: Sharon, de 22 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora y decidida, es conviviente con Erick, vive en casa de sus abuelos, junto a su pareja e hijo de 4 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Sharon es la venta de ropa femenina de todos los modelos, que le envía una tía que vive en la ciudad de Lima, para luego venderlos entre sus amistades y vecinos, tanto al contado como a crédito a 15 días. Tiene un año dedicandose a esta actividad, y gracias a ello tiene ingresos económicos que le han ayudado a compar enseres y artefactos electrodomésticos. Por ello dese ampliar su negocio y abrir una tienda de venta de ropa en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad de Pucallpa, así tendrá mayores ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el crédito anterior. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa femenina, para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
22-year-old Sharon is a hard-working and committed young woman.  She lives together with her partner Erick and her 4-year-old son in her grandparents' home.  Sharon's business is selling all types of women's clothing which she receives from an aunt who lives in the city of Lima.  She sells the clothes to her friends and neighbors either for cash or on two week's credit.  She has been in this business for one year and it has enabled her to make income which has helped her to buy household items and appliances.  For this reason, she would like to expand her business and open a clothes store in a commercial area of the city of Pucallpa which will make her more income.

This will be Sharon's second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can carry out her plans.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loan.  Sharon will invest the 1,000 soles she has requested in buying more women's clothing so that she can enjoy a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy more women's clothing

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Rechel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Rechel has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Felipa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to their community.

She has been in this business for 40 years now and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Felipa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Alomavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOMAVO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Christine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Christine est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Sondé. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à leur charge. Il y a dix ans, Christine mène comme activité la vente de produits cosmétiques et des pâtes dentifrices de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Christine vend des fruits ; ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses différentes charges. Christine achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Christine désire obtenir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOMAVO. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The ALOMAVO group is made up of three people who live in the same district.  The representative of the group, Christine, has her hand raised in the photo.  This is the second time that this group has requested financial assistance through ALIDé with the goal of increasing their business.  Christine is 41 years old and married to Sondé.  The couple has four children, all of whom attend school, and two of which are in their care.  For ten years, Christine has been in the business of selling cosmetic products and toothpaste as a traveling  vendor.  In addition to this, Christine also sells fruit, which helps her to meet different expenses.  Christine buys her products in Bénin.  With the goal of increasing her business activity and to better meet the demand of her customers, Christine would like to take out a second loan through ALIDé, together with the other members of the ALOMAVO group.  The preceding loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Clemencia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She been in business for fifteen years.

Clemencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.

In the future, Clemencia hopes to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra, 46, is a married woman who lives with her children in a rural village of the Phnom Preok district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

She earns a living growing rice and working as a paid worker. She earns  $17 USD per day (17,000 KHR per day). 

This is Ra's first loan with VisionFund and she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm. 

She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Nhóm 14- Thôn Bắc - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Phương is 25 years old and she is married and has two children. Phương is the group leader of the Nhóm 14- Thôn Bắc - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Phương operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2012, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a fish frying pan, Table and Jiko (cooking stove)

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis Z. lives with his wife Magda Calvimontes and their two children Jose and Fernanda, 7 and 5. They own their own home in Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. They purchased it in 2004 with savings from an "anticretico". [Translators note: An antichretic, or land-pawn, contract is an interesting rent-to-own arrangement common in Bolivia. You can read about it here: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html] The house is fifteen years old and made of stuccoed adobe. The shell has suffered with age and needs to be repaired. This loan will pay for removing the damaged exterior and replacing it with one of slaked lime or cement, which is more waterproof. This is the Z. family's first loan from IMPRO. Our study of their finances shows they will be able to repay the loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Luis Z. junto a su esposa, la señora Magda Calvimontes y sus hijos José y Fernanda de 7 y 5 años, son propietarios de una vivienda en la zona de Río Seco, ciudad de El Alto, adquirida el año 2004 con ahorros provenientes de un anticrético. El señor Z. trabaja en una empresa de servicios en la misma ciudad y su esposa es ama de casa. La vivienda, dado el tiempo y las características constructivas (La casa es de adobe revocado con estuco y su fabricación data de hace quince años), ha sufrido un deterioro que requiere refacción. El destino del crédito es para limpiar los muros exteriores del revoque ya deteriorado y realizar uno nuevo recubrimiento con cal, material de mayor impermeabilización. Es la primera ocasión que la familia Z. solicita un préstamo en nuestra institución y el análisis crediticio muestran que podrá cubrir sus obligaciones producto del crédito.

loans.use: Home rehab.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang S. is 22 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband.  Her husband earns $5/day working as a construction foreman.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Sang S. to purchase construction tools so her husband can expand his business.  He will be able to take on larger projects and hire more workers if he has these additional tools.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Eve

texts.en: Eve is a solo mother of 27 years of age. Living with her parents all of her life was the reason why she decided to start something of her own. Her father has been supporting her and her son, so it was a large burden on him. Eve heard of SPBD through the women in her village. She thought of running an ice cake business, but the problem was she would need to have a fridge to store them. Eve decided to start with pancakes since no one in the area was running a pancake business. She used her first loan to buy the equipment required, and on her first day of selling pancakes she managed to earn $100.00 tala. Eve is planning to run an ice cake business as a second business.

loans.use: To start her pancake business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Senora Wilma C. de Benitez and her husband have a young child who attends the public school. Her husband works in one of the best known shops in the zone called Municipal Market #4, one of the the main commercial zones of the city. Wilma has a business located in the center of Market #4, where she sells clothing for women, men and children. It has been growing as the years pass, thanks to the affluence of the people who come through the market.

Wilma is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise, such as seasonal clothing for summer to better meet the demand of all of her customers.

La Sra. Wilma C. de Benítez, es casada, el marido trabaja en uno de los comercios más conocidos de la zona del Mercado Municipal Nº 4 (uno de las principales zonas comerciales de la ciudad), tienen un hijo menor de edad, quien asiste a una escuela pública. Wilma posee un negocio ubicado en el centro del mercado 4, en el mismo se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, y que fue creciendo con el correr de los años, gracias a la gran afluencia de personas que posee el mercado. La señora Wilma, desea adquirir un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como ropas para la temporada de verano ya que se inicia y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de todos sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SEASONAL CLOTHING SUCH AS SHORTS, PANTS AND BLOUSES TO RESELL IN HER SHOP

loans.name: Famil

texts.en: Famil R. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Khojavend city in Azerbaijan.  Now he is settled with his family in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 51 years old, married and has three children.  Famil has a lorry and he is earning a living for his family by carrying luggage with his lorry.  Famil needs a loan in the amount of $500 for repairing his lorry.

loans.use: To develop his business

loans.name: Shakarmo

texts.ru:
Shakarmo H. is 43 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 6 children. Shakarmo fattens and sells livestock. She has been doing this for 8 years and this is her main source of income. Shakarmo will use her loan to purchase several young calves and feed to fatten them. Every 40-45 days she will sell them and purchase new calves. She will use her profits to support her family. Shakarmo’s husband and son help her in her business. She will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хидирова Шакармо, возраст – 43 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Шакармо занимается откормкой и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 8 лет и это основной источник приносящий ей доход. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести несколько молодых бычков, корма для их откорма. Через каждые 40-45 дней она будет продавать их и приобретать молодых бычков. Полученную прибыль от продажи будет использовать для содержание семьи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает муж и сын. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purcahse of calves and feed

loans.name: Cheri Mai

texts.en:
Cheri Mai M. is a shopkeeper in Thecho, Village. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives in a joint family home with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband and her four children. Her husband Mr. Tulshi M. works in a private office. Her older son is a teacher and her younger son is in grade 7. Her two daughters are studying in grades 11 and 8 respectively.
Mrs. M. opened her grocery shop 4 years ago. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulse, biscuits, and noodles in her shop. Her children also help her in her work. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area so she is requesting her second loan of Rs 15000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand. She is very grateful for your support. 
She spends the major part of her income to give a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Fatuma's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 2 children, aged 18 and 10. Fatuma owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Everyday she works from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Fatuma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 46 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 26 years old. Amina is a fish seller, and she started in 1984. Every day, she works from 5am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Ghislaine

texts.fr:
Born on 6 October 1979 in COTONOU, the economic capital of BENIN, Mrs.Ghislaine Z. is married and has twins named Conty and Constantine, who are 5 years old and in the first year of elementary school. She is a hairstylist by profession and has had a salon in YENAWA, a populous area of COTONOU, for more than 12 years. But alongside her hairstyling job, she sells trays of fresh eggs which she delivers to retailers and wholesalers. Due to the demand being very high, especially recently, she is asking for this loan to supply herself in order to meet the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 6 octobre 1979 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame Z. Ghislaine est mariée et mère de 2 jumeaux Conty et Constantine âgés de 5 ans et en classe de CI (Cours d'Initiation). Elle est coiffeuse de profession ayant son  salon de coiffure à YENAWA, un quartier populaire de COTONOU depuis plus de 12 ans. Mais parallèlement à la coiffure, elle vend des plateaux d’œufs frais qu’elle livre aux détaillants et aux semi-grossistes. La demande étant très forte surtout ces derniers temps, elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner afin de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy various cosmetic products and 100 trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Samnang Yang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang Y. is the leader of a five-person business group in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Samnang Y. can earn only a small income from her rice plantation, because she owns only a small part of a rice field. Mrs. Samnang Y. now wants to expand her rice product, so she is asking for a loan to buy another section of the rice field to grow vegetables, as well as rice.

Mrs. Samnang Y. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. One attends the local school. The youngest stays at home. Her husband, Mr. Savon Each, is a palm juice collector and a pig breeder.

The three men in the picture have come to receive the loans, instead of their wives since their wives (Soeurn P., Pheom Y. and Sary P.) were not present at the group meeting.

loans.use: To buy a piece of a rice field to grow rice and vegetables

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Mr. Marco A. lives in his parents’ home in the Alto Chijini zone of the city of La Paz. He is a business man who travels to the border to bring various types of home appliances and distributes them in the city. His parents gave him a space on their property so that he could build two rooms, since they currently only have one that he shares with his brother.

He is requesting a loan in order to construct a flagstone and walls for two rooms. This is the second time he requests a loan. His credit check favorably qualifies him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marco A. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona Alto Chijini en la ciudad de La Paz. El señor Marco es comerciante, realiza viajes a la frontera de donde trae productos electrodomésticos varios que luego distribuye en el comercio de la ciudad. Sus padres le otorgaron un espacio en su propiedad para que pueda construir dos habitaciones, ya que solo cuentan con una habitación que comparte con su hermano.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra gruesa de una loza y muros perimetrales para dos habitaciones. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construct a flagstone and walls for two rooms

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Mrs. Soem S. lives in Ank Doung Village in Kandal Province. She is a garment-factory worker who makes a small salary with which she supports her family. Her husband, Mr. No Thol, is a recycling collector who gathers cans, empty bottles and plastic to sell. Mrs. Soem S. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or attend school. She and her family live in an old house because they have a small income. Mrs. Soem S. would like to build a new house but does not have enough money, so she has decided to ask for a loan, which she will add to her savings to achieve her goal. Previously, Mrs. Soem S. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy a new motorbike and has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To improve her living conditions by building a new house.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey C., 40, is married and lives with her children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

Since 2000, she has been selling fruits in the market to earn a living and is able to make US$6.50 a day and is aided by her children who work as garment factory workers. Her husband, 41, has a small restaurant selling many kinds of meat, beer and wine. On average, he makes $2.50 of profit per day. This couple has five children, two are garment workers,  two work collecting recyclable items and the last one is a student.
