Mrs. Srey would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of US$600 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer to transport the fruits to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike with a trailer to transport the fruits to the market.

loans.name: Milca

texts.es: Milca  se dedica  a la venta de pescado, pero por la temporada y la escasez del mismo no está ejerciendo esta actividad, sin embargo trabaja en una casa como empleada domestica, sus ganas de seguir adelante son motivadas por sus hijos, que estudian y tienen mucho entusiasmo de continuar con sus estudios. Milca y su esposo Bernardo se apoyan mutuamente para lograr que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional.También desea mejorar su vivienda y para ello necesita comprar materiales de construcción, es por eso que requiere de un capital para llegar a concretar con su propósito.
texts.en:
Milca makes a living selling fish, but due to the season and product shortage, she's currently not partaking in this activity. Instead, she's working as a housemaid. Her goal is to make headway for her children, who are in school and are very enthusiastic about continuing their studies. Milca and her husband, Bernardo, support each other so their children can work toward a professional degree. She also wants to make improvements to their home, and for this she needs to purchase building materials. She's requesting a loan so she can carry out her intentions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to make repairs on her home

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres”, ubicado en al Jr. Los Pinos Mz. 9 Lt. 3 AA.HH Próceres de la Independencia, distrito de Manantay, provincia Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de una hija menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en la municipalidad de Coronel Portillo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el Banco de Crédito.  

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio “la venta de pescado”. Se levanta a las 4 a.m. para salir al puerto a comprar y luego vender variedades de pascados. Tiene el apoyo de su cuñada Maruja.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 bandejas de pescados diarios.  

Lucia agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud y al Banco de Manuela Ramos por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Señora Lucia belongs to the Communal Bank called "The flowers of the Illustrious" located in the district of Manantay in the city of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayalli. She's 39 years old. She's the mother of a little girl who still depends on her financially. She's married and her husband works for the city of Coronel Portillo. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling fish. She has been a client for over 6 years. She continues to sell fish. She gets up around 4 in the morning to go to the port to buy the fish which she later sells. She has the support of her sister-in-law named Maruja. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase 4 trays of daily fish. Lucia thanks God for life and good health and to Manuela Ramos for trusting her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Mrs. Nget Soun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of twenty-two members and is located in Roka village in Kandal Province, and they plan to use the loan proceeds for different purposes. Mrs. Nget S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a Khmer noodle seller. She has been earning progressively less income to support her household, and she now lives in poor conditions and so wants to start a new business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy tables, chairs, plates and so on to start a rice soup business. She is a 42-year-old widow with four children who are all attending the local school.

This is a group loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. One member has end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, plates and supplies to start a rice soup business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Doña Victoria tiene 60 años y vive con 2 de sus hijos. Esta mujer es muy diligente en el cuidado de sus vacas que tiene en su establo, desde temprano por la mañana se levanta para cortar el pasto y hacerlo reposar en sombra hasta que quede seca, ya que nos dice que el pasto húmedo puede ocasionar molestias a sus vacas y siempre cumple con el horario exacto en su alimentación, todos estos cuidados hacen que la calidad de leche  que producen sus vacas sea óptima, tanto así que una empresa lechera diariamente compra de la leche que sus vacas producen, para Doña Victoria esto es un gran aliciente que la motiva a seguir esforzándose. Es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y durante los ciclos anteriores ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará abono para la siembra de sus pastizales y garantizar el alimento de sus vacas.
texts.en:
Doña Victoria is 60 years old and lives with two of her children. She is very diligent in caring for her cows in her stable. She wakes up early in the morning to cut the fodder and let it rest in the shade until it dries. She explains that moist fodder can cause problems in her cows. The fodder is always ready exactly at feeding time. All of these precautions ensure that her cows produce high quality milk, so much so that it is purchased by a dairy company on a daily basis. For Doña Victoria this is a great incentive that motivates her. This is the fourth loan through MFP. During her previous loan cycles she has been punctual with her payments. With the money from the loan she will purchase fertilizer for the seeding of her pastureland and to guarantee the nutriment of her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the pastureland of her cows

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann U. sells prayer items like candles, olive oil, mustard seed, bibles, incense, etc. Ann is 50 years old and married with 4 children. Her youngest child is an under graduate at the institute of management and technology in Enugu state. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more prayer items to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more prayer items to sell

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA (composé de 6  mariées et une célibataire)  ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans avec en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  de kaboila II de la ville de sikasso.
Les femmes de ce groupe  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais la plus dominante est la vente d’orange, d’huile alimentaire, de chaussures et d’igname.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt  10 chargements de charrettes  en orange, 10 douzaines de chaussures, 20 sacs d’igname.
Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso, à  Bobo (Burkina Faso) et à  Bamako (capitale du Mali).
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans le marché de la ville de Sikasso, dans le quartier et  dans certains marchés des villages environnants,  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Dembagnouma group (composed of 6 married women and one unmarried) have an average age of 35 with on average, 2 children. They live in the Kaboila II district of the town of Sikasso.

The women of this group have varied commercial activities but the main one is selling oranges, cooking oil, shoes, and cocoyams.

They work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele. They are on their 5th solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this loan they intend to buy 10 wagon loads of oranges, 10 dozen shoes, and 20 sacks of cocoyams. They do their buying right in Sikasso, in Bobo (Burkina Faso), and in Bamako (capital of Mali). The products are sold retail and mostly for cash in the market of the town of Sikasso, in the neighborhood and in certain markets in nearby villages, to a clientele composed of women and men.

They each hope to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA monthly, money that will be used to cover family expenses, investing any remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of oranges, shoes, and cocoyams

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. owns a rice field. She is 37 years old and has 2 children. She dreamed of having a carabao (water buffalo) someday to plow her field. Now, she is renting a tractor to really loosen the soil before planting rice. Her husband is the one who manages their farm. Their harvest is what they use to raise their family and provide for their daily needs. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 from Kiva's partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and to rent a tractor. The loan will truly help Zenaida grow her harvest. She also is willing to venture to another line of business. In this way, she could be able to contribute more to the family income. 

CEVI provides Zenaida credit assistance. Aside from that, CEVI gives all their clients training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rent a tractor

loans.name: Agbodjinsi

texts.fr: Agée d’une cinquantaine d’années, Mme Agbodjinsi A. est une veuve avec huit (08) enfants à charge. Pour faire face à la scolarisation de ses enfants, elle vend des produits alimentaires de premières nécessités (légumes, tomates fraîches, épices et autres ingrédients) dans le marché de son village. C’est une femme très appréciée dans son milieu qui draine avec elle un nombre considérable de clients. Cette sollicitude permanente de ses clients l’oblige à demander un crédit afin de pouvoir satisfaire pleinement leurs demandes. Cela va également lui permettre d’accroître ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
In her fifties, Agbodjinsi A. is a widow with eight dependent children. In order to pay her children's tuition, she sells basic foodstuffs (vegetables, fresh tomatoes, spices and other ingredients) in the market of her village. She is very well regarded in her area and attracts a large number of customers. Her clients' demands are what brings her to ask for a loan in order to satisfy them. The loan will also allow her to increase her revenues and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. is married with four children and has no formal education. Since 2002, she has worked as a trader selling goods such as kenkey (fermented white maize food) and groundnut paste at Sekondi Market near Shama Junction. Her husband is employed as a cold store operator, selling frozen fish and other types of meat. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in paying for the family’s housekeeping expenses. Mary will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs for selling. Mary plans to save the new profits she gains from her expanded business in order to ensure her continued success.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs for selling

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Thân Nguyễn Thị (1406030256) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily rice, for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2003, Thân joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

Thân is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. The loan will be her 7th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Vilma Luisa

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del bancomunal Maria D. la Paz.
Vilma es casada tiene 53 años, siete hijos, todos son mayores e independientes.
Se dedica a la venta D. gas , empezó con 2 balones D. gas, ahora venD. 15 balones D. gas diario.
DesD. que esta en Finca, pueD. ahorrar aprendió hacer solidarias.
Vilma necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para la compra D. gas y D. balones D. gas.
El sueño D. Vilma es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the community bank Maria D. la Paz. She is 53, and married with 7 children, all of whom are older and live independently. Vilma sells natural gas. She began selling two cylinders per day, but now she is up to 15. In her time with FINCA, she has been able to save money, and has learned to stand in solidarity with her fellow members. Vilma needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy gas and fresh cylinders. Vilma's dream is that her business continues to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gas and fresh cylinders

loans.name: Beveline

texts.en:
Beveline R. is from the village of San Roque, Iligan City. She is 37 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Beveline owns and operates a specialized retail store selling variety products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste , milk, and coffee. Beveline has been engaged in her business for over three years in the local community and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Beveline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to invest in expanding the business. She is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Roque, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Flor de María se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de productos personales siendo ofertados en su localidad el cual es muy visitado por muchos clientes por estar en un lugar céntrico en el mercado Central de León.

Ella tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y por ese motivo es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así mejorar las condiciones de su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Mrs. Flor de María runs her own business selling personal products. Her products are sold in her shop in the center of León's Central Market. Due to its central location, her shop is visited by many customers. Needing to invest in her business, she has approached Ceprodel to benefit from a loan, which will improve her business that is so greatly in need of an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of personal products

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold C. is a 37-year-old married man who has one daughter. His only daughter, Bolortuya, age 19, is a university student. His family lives in a condominium that he owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.

Ganbold makes sofas and sells them at the Narantuul market, the biggest four-season outdoor market in the capital city. He purchases unprocessed wood, cotton and other raw materials for 150,000 tugrugs (~ $100 USD) per sofa. Then he sells each sofa for 220,000-230,000 tugrugs (~$150 - $160). He makes 10 sofas per month on average and sells all of them.

Ganbold's wife, Purevsuren, helps in her husband's business. She usually works as a saleswoman at the Narantuul market. With the profits, Ganbold has purchased a plot of land. With future profits, he is planning to build a house on the land he owns next year. He is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells fish and cloth at Elmina. Mary has received no formal education.  She is married and has two children. Mary has been selling fish and cloth since 1990. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy more for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for resale

loans.name: Gavelela Group

texts.en:
Gavelela is a group of 5 borrowers, led by James Z., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  James is married with 1 child, age 7, who is in kindergarten.  He  is 28 years old, has an 8th grade education, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

James’ business is selling dry goods retail, including clothing, toiletries, and jewelry, which he buys wholesale in neighboring Guinea.  He has been running his business for 8 years.   He’s taking a loan to increase his inventory sufficiently so he can serve more customers.  With the profits he dreams of building a more permanent shop, and investing in the future of his son, especially investing in education he was unable to complete school.

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is a resident of Barangay Ineangan Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now 50 years old and has been blessed with four children, two boys and 2 girls. Because of financial difficulty, she and her husband, Alexander, help each other to provide for the needs of their family, especially for their children’s education.

Her husband is a carpenter in Carranglan, Nueva Ecija. Teresita, on the other hand, is vending different products such as vegetables, cooked snacks, fruits, etc. She sells her products house to house and she is able to generate a daily gross income of PHP500. Daily, Teresita purchases her products for selling in Nueva Vizcaya Agricultural Terminal (NVAT). She is borrowing additional business capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP11,000.00 to purchase bigger quantities of her vending products in order to be able to gain bigger income. She is hoping that lenders will give her the opportunity to improve her business through the Kiva lenders financial assistance.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim K. is a villager in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is duck breeder to make duck eggs for sell in the local market. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more 100 ducks for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Nhoung Bross, is a recycling collector. Mrs. Yim K. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more 100 ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: N. Célestine est née en 1960 et vit au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis trente ans. Célestine s’est mariée à EZIN Didier, un tailleur. Célestine et Didier vivent ensemble et ont trois enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Célestine n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. C’est pourquoi, pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Célestine vend depuis dix huit ans déjà, des œufs, du maïs et du riz à la devanture de sa maison à Cadjèhoun.  Célestine achète ces produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Célestine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Célestine souhaite agrandir davantage son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Célestine sollicite à nouveau un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Célestine N. was born in 1960 and has lived in the Cadjèhoun à Cotonou neighborhood, economical capital of Benin, for thirty years. Célestine is married to Didier Ezin, a tailor. Célestine and Didier live together and have three children in their charge who all attend school. Célestine did not have the luck to go to school. This is the reason why Célestine has sold eggs, corn and rice from the store-window of her house in Cadjèhoun for 18 years; to provide for her needs and those of her children. Célestine buys these products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Célestine is a former customer of ALIDé that already has obtained three loans, which she repaid well to ALIDé. Célestine wishes to grow her business and better satisfy her clientele. This is the reason Célestine requests a fourth credit with ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs and sacks of corn and rice for resale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has been a carpenter since 1999, distributing his products to clients upon request. He is a 43-year-old single man living with his parents and six brothers. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy additional wood to make more products in order to satisfy the heavy demand of the market.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a clothing business. The primary source of income for the business comes from sewing and repairing clothes in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional clothes for her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes for her business

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola sells crates of eggs at retail prices to her customers. She is 44 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a farm manager.

Bola has been in this business for six years and sells for long hours to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke is an LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Jumoke is 50 years old. She is a widow with 4 children, her youngest 20 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Jumoke sells Nigerian cooked foods to earn a living. She starts the preparation of her cooked foods daily at 4:30 a.m.  She is a hard working woman who believes so much that hard work pays. Jumoke is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 30,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Kimsor

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsor B., age 48 and his wife, Mrs. Pov Soun, age 47, live in a small village along national road number four approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penn City.  They have been married since 1982 and have three sons. One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home. Kimsor is not in the photo; his wife is shown instead.
 
Kimsor has been selling cows and oxen for 20 years. He buys them from other provinces far away from his house and sells to a middleman who comes to buy it at his house. His wife stays at home and does housework. 

Kimsor hopes to expand his business, so he is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional cows and oxen for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and oxen for resale.

loans.name: Aïsatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou F. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 4 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, une activité qui lui procure des bénéfices lui permettant de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
Aïssatou F., 46, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of PALENE for four years. She works at fattening cattle, a business from which she draws income that allows her to help support the family and also put aside more in savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: grow her working capital

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en: T. Trương Thị's main source of income comes from raising cattle for sale. She is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Yên P. - Bắc Ninh. T. is married and has three adult children. She has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 dong (VND) a month. T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. T. is requesting a loan for the first time from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. T. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. T. is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01)". ID: 20203020001 About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Hà Thị T. is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. ID: 20203020004 2. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. ID: 20203020006 3. Nguyễn Thị X. is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services. ID: 20203020008 4. Trần Thị N. is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. ID: 20203020011 5. Cao Thị P. is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business operating a service-based business. ID: 20203020012 About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Trương Thị (20203020001) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên P. - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND. T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Hà Thị T. (20203020004) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. Nguyễn Thị L. (20203020006) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 3. Nguyễn Thị X. (20203020008) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. 4. Trần Thị N. (20203020011) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Cao Thị P. (20203020012) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Phav

texts.en:
Mrs. Phav T. is a villager who lives in Ta Pov Village in Takeo Province. 

She is a rice middleman, a person who buys large quantities of rice to keep in stock and then re-sells it later for a better price. Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in her stock. 

Her husband, Mr. Huy Heang, is a farmer. Mrs. Phav T. is the mother of five children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in her stock.

loans.name: Hélèné

texts.fr: Hélène S. est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 3 ans et a 6 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle s'est spécialisée dans l'embouche bovine et ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter deux paires de bœufs qu'elle engraissera pour revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène S. is 33 years old, married and mother of three children, all under her care. She has been a member of the NGOHE ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for three years and has benefited from six successive loans. She specialized in the fattening of cattle, and this loan will allow her two buy two pairs of oxen she will fatten for sale after four to five months. She participates in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oxen for fattening

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly K., age 36, is married and resides with her two children in Takeo province, Cambodia.

K. is engaged in a business selling nylons, earning an income of 2.30 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver in the city, earning an income of 3.30 USD per day. Their standard of living has been improved since K. and her husband have had these businesses.

K. is requesting a loan of 1,100 USD to purchase more nylons for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more nylons for sale

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Balok. She is 66 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a farm which is planted with different kinds of plants, especially rice and corn. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the income of her husband as a carpenter. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers for the plants. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the plants.

loans.name: Virginia Enoque

texts.pt:
Virgínia Inoque C. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique tem 29 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 11, 09 e 02 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da Matola para o Distrito de Boane quando contraiu o seu Matrimonio ha 14 anos. Vive com a sua família neste Distrito e desenvolve o seu negócio desde a sua chegada. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt a 3.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha no Ministério da Saúde poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 11.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e, óleo e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 9.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Virgínia Enoque C. was born in Matola City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 29, married, and the mother of three children, ages 11, 9 and 2. The two elder children go to school. Virgínia only finished fifth grade and did not continue school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else. She left Matola to move to Boane District when she married 14 years ago. She has lived in this District with her family and run her own business since her arrival here. She has no employees and earns about 2,000 to 3,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. With the help of her husband, who works for the Ministry of Health, she saves some money in their bank account. Virgínia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is Virgínia's third loan. She is asking for 11,500 meticais, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and oil and other items) to continue construction on her home. The earlier loans were for 6,000 meticais and 9,000 meticais, both for the same purpose. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she may take out other loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron, san and oil and other items)

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg N., 33, lives with her son in Hovd province, Mongolia. Two years ago, she was divorced from her husband and now lives with her son in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). Her son attends kindergarten. Currently, Enhtsetseg operates a grocery store in her town. She has been running her grocery store since 2002, and has steadily expanded her business. She has gained significant experience over the past eight years and has built a loyal customer base. Her product sales are quite good.

Enhtsetseg has been planning to operate a clothing trading business in addition to her grocery store business. She has been working hard to provide a better life for her son. She has a great business mind and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan so she can operate a clothing trading business in addition to her current business.

loans.use: To open a clothing trading business

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene L. is from the village of Balbagon in Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Charlene is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Charlene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Charlene has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Charlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used expand her business. Charlene is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Charlene's 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Loemheang's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of six members in Preaek Hang village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, with the goal of improving their individual businesses. 

Mrs. Loemheang M. is the group leader, selected by the six members. She is 35 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Hak Sroeurn, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land on which they grow crops, which they sell to support their family as well as to pay their farming laborers. They have a child currently enrolled in the local public school.

Their current obstacle is that it is time to plow their field and harvest their crops, but they do not have enough money. Therefore, Mrs. Loemheang M. is asking for a loan in order to rent a plow machine in order to plow her field.

loans.use: To rent a plow machine in order to plow her field

loans.name: Daniel Napoleón

texts.es:
Daniel Napoleón S. S. tiene 49 años. Vive con sus hijos, Ruth (15) y Génesis (3), en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Daniel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos S. con la Cooperativa San José.

Daniel se dedica al comercio de chanchos y ganado. Compra sus productos en Bucay y los vende  en su propia casa. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar animales, para incrementar su negocio de chanchos y ganado. Su sueño es tener una granja mucho más grande para poner todos los animales. 

Le gusta practicar deporte en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Daniel Napoleón S. S. is 49 years old and lives with his children, Ruth (15) and Génesis (3), in the Chillanes hamlet, located in the Bolívar province. Daniel is an associate of the “Ventanilla Rural Santa Rosa,” (Santa Rosa Rural Window), located and hour and a half from Chillanes. There are a total of 18 members, most of whom run their own businesses. This will be their first loan through “Cooperativa San José.” Daniel is in the hog and livestock business. He buys his products in Bucay and sells them out of his home. He is asking for this loan in order to buy more animals so that he can grow his business. He hopes to have a much larger farm, someday, where he can keep his animals. Le enjoys playing sports in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI I  est composé  de femmes mariées du village de  Sokan dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent essentiellement de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
SETOU D., la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera  utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses  courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group, Benkadi I, is made up of married women from the village of Sokan in the San prefecture, a region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. They are on average 34 years old and have at least 5 children. They mainly grow peanuts. In order to make their agricultural businesses more profitable, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program 3 years ago. After having fully paid back their previous loans, they are on their third farm loan. Setou D., the president of the group, expects to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small tools and material inputs at the large market in Kimparana. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a certain amount of time so that they may be valued before being sold at the large market in Kimparana, M'peresso and on the surrounding markets at retail (often at wholesale) for cash to a customer base largely coming from big cities. After the sale of their agricultural products, the members of the group each expects to make a profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the interest on their loans and the everyday expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material inputs, seeds, and small tools.

loans.name: Ablayo

texts.fr: cette femme a appris le métier de la couture, après sa formation, elle a ouvert en 2006 son propre atelier de couture qu'elle a appelé "CREATION DICO", elle confectionne bien les habits ce qui lui permet d'avoir tout le temps des demandes de sa clientèle. le matériel de couture qu'elle utilise est épuisé, elle sollicite un  prêt pour acheter des fils, des aiguilles,des grippures et divers.
texts.en:
This lady became a seamstress and after her training opened her own sewing studio in 2006; she named it "CREATION DICO". She makes dresses and always completes her customers' requests in time. The fabric that she uses has run out and so she is seeking a loan in order to buy thread, needles, and other items.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sewing materials

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
Yoni nació en la ciudad de Marcapata provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Yoni vive en la ciudad Ocongate junto con su esposo y su hija de un año de nacida. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Yoni es una mujer joven y humilde que tiene 23 años, que abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en una habitacion alquilada y está ubicado en la calle Libertad de la ciudad de Ocongate. A Yoni la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche en su tienda. 
 
Con el próximo préstamo, Yoni que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos  y muchas cosas más que falta en la tienda. 

Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. El sueño de la socia es abrir más tiendas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yoni was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Yoni currently lives with her husband and one year old daughter in the city where she was born. The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco. Yoni is a humble young woman who is 23 years old. She opened a small grocery store in her rented home. It is located on Libertad street in the city of Ocongate. Yoni can be found in her store seven days a week from eight in the morning until ten at night. With the next loan Yoni hopes to receive 1,000 soles. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, and many other things that her store does not have. She has participated in the communal bank for two years. It is going very well for her thanks to the reliability of her colleagues and the punctuality of their payments. Her dream is to open more stores. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, and many other things

loans.name: Chom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chom S. is a 33-year-old woman married to Mr. Phat Sophea, who is 32 years old and works as a construction worker. They have a child, who just a year old. Chom is the leader of a group loan who was selected by its four members located in Trapeang Chak village, Kandal province.

Chom earns a living as a seamstress in a garment factory. With both of their jobs they are able to earn a small income that supports their family. In order to increase their income and improve the family’s standard of living, Chom decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this new business they hope that their family’s life will improve.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: White Group

texts.en:
Matthew A. is in his mid-forties and is married with two children, aged 12 and 9. Matthew operates a small food shop that he has been running for 10 years. The shop is open daily between 12 am and 11pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Matthew’s 3rd 'Motisha' loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A 'Mothisha' loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term would have ended. He used his previous two loans on increasing shop inventory, and both have been successfully repaid. He aims to use his third loan on buying more land. Matthew’s dream is to one day build a house for himself on this new land.

 

Matthew will share this loan with his loan group, White, which has 6 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loans.

 

In the picture, Matthew is seen in the first row, on the left, wearing a black suit.

loans.use: To buy land to one day build a house

loans.name: Think Big Group

texts.en:
Stephen K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Think Big.  He is 32 years old, single, and has one child who is four years old. He is a junior student at a local university.

For 10 years, he has been selling bags, used towels and t-shirts in Duala Market in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 25,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 100,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of bags, used towels and t-shirts. He describes himself as a hard-working man whose dream is to improve his business and  build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Annie is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of bags, used towels and t-shirts

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina F. is from the village of Brgy. Darubba, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product line. This will be the second loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product line

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha B. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (four relatives: sisters and brother).

Aisha has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market by means of wholesale and retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and motorcycle for hire.

The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include transportation and the rainy season, which makes village roads impassable. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to built other rental rooms. Aisha lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Vanancio

texts.en: K. Vanancio is 33 years old and he has been running his agricultural business in Rukungiri for 5 years. The business has been bringing in 240,000 UGX for him. Vanancio is married with 2 children. He says that he will use this loan to pay for the upgrading of his banana plantations. He is also involved in the sale of soya beans, other beans, etc.

loans.use: to upgrade his banana plantations

loans.name: The Nargis Maqsood Masih Group

texts.en:
Nargis lives in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She lives there with her family in a small housing colony named Arshad in a two-room brick house. Nargis moved there 10 years ago. She is divorced, and her family’s financial responsibilities are on her shoulders, although she has a daughter who supports her financially by working in a factory and earning a monthly wage. Nargis lives with her brother who is a property dealer. 

Nargis operates a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from wholesale markets in Lahore and sells them to different shops in Riwind and also to local customers.  She is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy larger quantities of a wider variety of clothes to improve her sales and income. Nargis is a regular Asasah loan recipient and this is her second application. She has good credit and has never missed a meeting.

Nargis is hopeful that this investment will make her business more profitable and that she will be able to build a dowry for her daughter’s marriage with her profits. In this photo, Nargis is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a food vending business for the past five years, selling at the market, from door to door and from home. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During dry hot season the availability of food stuff for sale in the market is inadequate and the demand is high while during cold winter season the supply of food is high in the market and demand is low. She hopes to own a café business in the future. 

With the 15000 KES she wants to purchase wheat flour, sacks of beans, cooking oil and kitchen utensils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sacks of beans, cooking oil and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luis Humberto C. M.  tiene 19 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con los padres  en  el  Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luis Humberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en: Luis Humberto C. M., 19, is single and living with his parents in Monacache Canton, Rios Province.  He has no children.  The members of the V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE Group, located in Santa Sofia enclosure, earn their living in short-season agriculture, especially corn, rice and beans, spending a great deal of time at their work.  Luis Humberto also grows corn, rice, and beans.  He buys his supplies in the Comercial Briones and sells his products in the Comercial Vaca y García.  He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn, rice, and beans.  This loan will help him economically to provide for his necessities.  They face challenges such as infestations and diseases, and weather variability.  His dream is to buy a house and land.  He enjoys sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Adiba's Group

texts.en:
Adiba is a hardworking lady by nature. She stitches footballs to financially support her family. She receives orders from different football selling shops and fulfills the orders on time to earn income for her family. Her husband is a transport loader by profession. He uses his donkey cart to deliver the items from one place to another. He has been operating this business for over 10 years. Through his good services, many customers approach him to deliver their items to their destinations.

Abida has 3 sons and a daughter. Her 2 elder sons are tailors by trade and sew men’s clothes. Her third son studies in 2nd standard while her daughter is only 4 years old. Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new cart because his current cart has gotten rough and rotten from constant use. He can’t put heavy loads in it and, as a result, his business is suffering. 
 
Abida is hopeful that a new cart will help her husband deliver more loads and to provide better services to his clients and make more income. Abida is a new loan user of Asasah. She is very confident that this step will bring good profits to her husband. She lives with her family in the area named Kalar abadi which is located in a city named Gujranwala. Gujranwala is a mid-sized city in Pakistan and known for its rice industry.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business.

loans.name: Dolores Eulalia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Cristo Resucitado.

La señora Dolores es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque  los pagos son cómodos y fáciles de cumplir. Tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de  edad, su hija vive en su casa y  estudia en universidad. Su marido es chofer.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Su hija le ayuda con las ventas ya que lleva los productos a la Universidad donde ella estudia y les vende a sus compañeras de clase. Nos cuenta que los perfumes y la bisutería es lo que más vende, aunque dice que todo se vende porque es un gran producto.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Sus sueños son tener una boutique y que su hija sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Libertad # 2 of the city of Portoviejo -- the capital de Manabí province, known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds" -- the members of the "Risen Christ" Communal Bank hold their meetings. 

Dolores is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because the payments have good terms and are easy to fulfill. She is 43 years old and has a common-law husband. She has two children from this relationship who are already grown. Her daughter lives at home and attends the university. Her husband is a driver. 

She is a housewife, but to obtain her own resources, she works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day of the week, offering her products on credit and collecting payments each week or every two weeks, according to her customers' desires. Her daughter helps her with the sales, taking the products to the university where she studies and selling them to her classmates. She reports that the perfumes and costume jewelry are most popular, although she says that everything sells, because they are great products. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry. Her dreams are to have her own boutique and to see her daughter become a successful professional.

loans.use: Buying creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry

loans.name: Las Damas De La Colosio Group

texts.es: El Nombre de este grupo es Las Damas de la Colosio, en mención a la colonia donde viven  y por ser  todas unas Respetables Damas, El Grupo se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Quintana Roo, México y está conformado por 11 integrantes. La señora Francisca Acuña C. es una de las integrantes del grupo, la señora tiene 46 años de edad y estudio hasta la primaria, ella vende frutas y verduras, tiene 3 hijos; dos mujeres de 17 y 14 años y un varón de 11 años. Comenzó su negocio de Frutas y verduras desde hace 3 años, ella solicita el préstamo para surtir su negocio y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así satisfacer sus necesidades, ya Q. es la única recatería en la colonia, ella vende las frutas y verduras más frescas y nutritivas. Con este préstamo la Señora Francisca espera ampliar su negocio y poder surtirse, y de las ganancias Q. generen poder apoyar a sus hijos para Q. terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Damas de la Colosio” [The Ladies of the Colosio] in honor of their colony and because they are all well respected ladies. The group is from the Quintana Roo State in Mexico and is made up of 11 members. Mrs. Francisca Acuna C. is one of them. She is 46 years old and attended school until the end of elementary. She has three children, two girls who are 17 and 14 and a boy who is 11 years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years.

She is requesting the loan to stock and enlarge her business, better serve her costumers and provide a necessary service since her produce retail store is the only one in the colony. She sells the most fresh and nutritious fruits and vegetables. She wants to be able to support her children and provide for their schooling.

loans.use: To stock her business up with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. accesorios para celulares, vive con su esposo y su hijo D. 4 años D. edad, residen en Jucuapa departamento D. Usulután,  este negocio D. María está ubicado en su propia casa, no tiene un horario fijo y para iniciarlo tomo un curso donD. aprendió la reparación D. los móviles. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. accesorios como baterías, estuches, tarjetas entre otros, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el negocio, atender más clientes y mejorar su vida cotidiana, las aspiraciones D. ella es tener un negocio fuerte, ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María, who sells mobile phone accessories, lives with her husband and 4-year-old son in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután.  María runs her business out of her own home and does not have fixed working hours.  Before setting up her activity she took a course in mobile phone repair.

She is requesting the loan to buy accessories such as batteries, cases, cards and other items.  This investment will help her improve her business, proviD. better service to customers and improve her family's lifestyle.

She aspires to making her business strong so she can proviD. a better future for her family.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Bich's Group

texts.en:
Bich T. N. is 33 years old.  She lives with her 3 children in Kinh No village. She operates a small grocery shop from her house, selling many kinds of products  such as wine, rice, beer, etc.   Her business has developed well since she received a loan from our credit program in 2005.   Bich earns 100,000 VND daily in profit from this shop, which helps her cover family expenditures. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Van T. N. is 35 years old and has 2 children. She raises ducks for eggs. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy feed.

Ha T. B.  is 45 years old and has 2 children. She grows fruits trees and raises chickens for meat. She needs a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy feed and fertilizer.

Thinh T. N. is 47 years old. She raises chickens and ducks for meat. She needs a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to  invest in her shop

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Рахимова Зулфия проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 33 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж, находится в России на заработках. Сама Зулфия занимается пошивкой женской одежды. То есть она шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Целью кредита является приобретение новой швейной машинки для вышивки.
texts.en: Zulfia R. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is now working in Russia. Zulfia sews women's clothing. She makes national Tajik dresses. She has been in this business for two years. The purpose of the loan is to buy a new machine for embroidering.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for embroidering

loans.name: Eva Marie

texts.en:
Eva Marie is 40 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eva Marie has a business venture making and selling food in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more ingredients to expand her business.

Eva Marie has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Señor De Huarancayo Group

texts.es:
Marisela 49 años D. edad, casada, 2 hijos D. 16 y 14 años respectivamente. Socia D. la alcancìa comunal: "Señor D. Huarancayo", en la provincia D. Jauja - Huancayo.
Marisela tiene como negocio venta D. comida en su casa; adicionalmente tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes al costado D. su casa.
marisela tiene a sus 2 hijos en edad escolar y aùn son dependientes.
El prèstamo solicitado es para comprar al por mayor vivires y productos D. primera necesidad para su restaurante.
(En la fotografìa Marisela esta vestida con casaca color gris y polo color negro, esta al medio y en la parte del fondo D. la foto)
Los socios que no se encuentran en la foto son: 
- Nancy D. Y., no estuvo presente por encontrarse laborando;
- Ediecilda Marinez C., no estuvo presente por estar D. viaje;
- Edgardo C. T., no estuvo presente porque llegò tarD./ estuvo trabajando.
texts.en:
Marisela is 49 years old, married, and has two children aged 16 and 14.  She is a member of the "Señor D. Huarancayo" community bank which is located in Jauja, Huancayo.

Marisela's business is selling food in her home.  She also has a small grocery store next to her home.  Marisela has two school-age children who are still dependent on her.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy food products and essentials (wholesale) for her restaurant.

(In the photograph, Marisela is wearing a gray jacket and a black polo shirt).

The members who are not in the photo are:
- Nancy D. Y. - who couldn't attend because she was working
- Ediecilda Marinez C. - who couldn't attend because she was away
- Edgardo C. T. - who couldn't attend because he arrived late / was working.

loans.use: to buy food products for her restaurant

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Шерматов Ибодулло проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 51 год. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его дети работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама он имеет средне - специальное образование, шафер. В этой области работает 12 лет. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи и злаковые культуры для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян риса, минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Ibodullo S. lives in Shahrituz. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His children work on a small farm. He has a vocational education as a driver.  He has been working as a driver for twelve years.  He also farms. He primarily grows vegetables and grains for sale. He has been farming for more than ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy rice seed, mineral fertilizer, and fuel for a tractor.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, mineral fertilizer, and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, chicken gizzards, beef, rice, flour, eggs, beans, soft drinks and charcoal.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita vive en la comunidad de Acteopan, tiene 28 años de edad es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo Imanol de 10 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, ella se dedica a la alfarería elabora jarros y cazuelas, ella solicito su crédito para comprar la materia prima como el barro, la leña y la greta,  ella inicio con su negocio hace 10 años sus papas le enseñaron a trabajar el barro desde pequeñas y con un ahorro que tenía guardado en su casa compro el material y comenzó a elaborar los jarros y las cazuelas, para ella es muy importante su negocio porque es el sustento y puede cubrir los gastos de su casa y du su hijo para que siga en sus estudios , ella eta orgullosa con este trabajo porque es herencia de sus papas y le gusta ver que sus jarros y sus cazuelas le quedan muy bonitas, ella sale a vender a las ferias de Tepetlixpa, Ameca meca, ella tiene la esperanza de que su negocio siga creciendo y no falte nada en su casa y que su hijo siga estudiando, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por ayudarnos en nuestro negocio para que siga adelante “. San Marcos es bonito la mayoría se dedica a elaborar la loza o la alfarería, siembra  maíz y sorgo en tiempos de lluvias”.
texts.en:
Margarita, 28, lives in the community of Acteopan.  She is a single mother of a ten-year-old son, Imanol; he is in elementary school.  She is a potter; she makes jugs and pots.  She asked for her loan to buy raw material like clay, firewood and “greta” (chemical mixture based on copper oxide and lead). 

She started her business ten years ago with her parents who taught her how to mold clay when she was still a little girl.  She used a few savings she had at home to buy raw materials and started to make jugs and pots.  For her, the business is very important because it’s the legacy she got from her parents and she likes to see that her jugs and pots turn out to be very beautiful.  She goes out to sell them at the markets in Tepetlixpa and Amecameca.  She has the hope that her business will continue growing and that she’ll not want for anything at home and that her son continues going to school.  

She wants to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you for helping us so that our business can continue making progress.” San Marcos is pretty; most of its residents are potters and during the rainy season they farm corn and sorghum.

loans.use: to buy clay, firewood and "greta" to make jugs and pots.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat is 45 years old and married with six children. All of them are getting their education from a local school. Her two elder sons operate a hosiery business along with their education to be able to afford their education fee. 

Ulfat also makes shirt collars to order and earns a reasonable amount of income from her business. The earned income helps her pay utility bills. Besides her business, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

Her husband operates a sanitary supplies business. He also offers his customers sanitary fitting services as well. He makes deals with different people who are looking for sanitary work for their homes. 

Ulfat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her collar-making business. With the loan, she will buy cloth and thread for making collars in larger quantity to be able to fill orders on time and earn more profit. She has been operating her business for the past three years and hopes it will improve further after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Ulfat.

loans.use: To buy cloth & thread for shirt-collar-making business.

loans.name: Campamento Group

texts.en: Jorge, Norma, and Alis, all of whom reside in Danli, Honduras, formed the “Campamento” solidarity group in June 2011. Jorge has made a living through cultivating vegetables and livestock for the past 50 years. Jorge owns several acres of land where he mainly grows beans and corn. He also raises cattle. Jorge is requesting a loan of LPS. 5,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide. The other group members, Alis and Norma, make a living though agriculture and selling clothes, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Sarah  has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods & beverages.

Sarah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 3 years.  She also earns more income from selling frozen foods.  

Margie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to upgrade tools and equipment and buy stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: upgrade equipment and buy frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Chester Danilo

texts.es: El señor Chester , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su papá , don  Chester desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña que junto a su padre lucha día a día para  llevar el pan a su vivienda , don Chester se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva  ya que con estos financiamiento  inducen el cultivo de piña ,  dando como resultado una buena producción y logro vender el producto en un precio bueno , el cual obtuvo el  beneficio  de comprar una camionetita usada para trasladar su producto al mercado y no  tener que estar pagando para  sacar el producto de las tierras donde las siembran .
texts.en:
Sr. Chester is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and to support his father. Don Chester has been growing pineapple for several years. He and his father strive each day to provide for the needs of their household.

Don Chester is very pleased with the support AFODENIC has provided by supplying Kiva funds. The loans have helped him with his pineapple crop, resulting in good production and the ability to sell his crop at a good price. With the profits he earned, he was able to buy a small used truck for transporting his product to market. He no longer has to pay someone to transport his crops once they have been harvested.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
This is Emelyn, 30, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rommel, a farmer, and is a mother of two children.
