loans.use: To buy spare parts such as tires and many other things which her car needs

loans.name: Jane Wanjiku

texts.en:
Jane is a 52-year-old married woman who is the mother of three children aged 15, 17 and 22 respectively. She lives in Gathangara in Kiambu, a peri-urban town with a lot of agricultural activity. Jane sells cereals to the residents of Gathangara area and is also involved in tea farming. For the past four years, cereal selling has been her primary business. 

Jane got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions.  Jane would like to become a wholesale cereal seller and sustain her business. She has applied for a loan to add more cereals and grains, such as maize, beans, peas and potatoes, to her stock.

loans.use: to buy cereals and grains

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por un familiar. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta ambulante de helados en un carrito. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Juana ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Juana es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Juana, 55, is a mother living with her family in a marginal urban area of the city of Chiclayo, quite a commercial zone located in Northern Perú.

She has a small general store in her home that a family member tends to.  They offer their neighbors and customers from the area diverse products for daily consumption and groceries.  The business is very well received.  She also is a street vendor of ice cream.  With these activities she is able to help her husband support the family.

The growing demand Juana has been experiencing lately in the store has made her think of enlarging it acquiring more products.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

Juana is quite a hard working woman of very good character.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

She has operated a food stall selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Monica faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future. With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it is a simple process and requires no legal formalities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and  fish for resale.

loans.name: Fausto Absalon

texts.es:
Fausto Absalon G. V. tiene 39 años de edad, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Fausto Absalon se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta cuidar a las aves del corral.
texts.en: Fausto Absalon G. V. is 39. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province. He has 2 children. The members of the V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, district of San Antonio, San José del Tambo Parish, are located 150 minutes from the community, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour: the sowing of corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Fausto Absalon works in agriculture, sowing corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. He buys his products in the Matilde Esther Market and sells them in Bucay. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his necessities. He has to confront challenges such as plagues and diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a plot of land. He likes to care for barnyard birds.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es: La señora Maribel tiene 31 años y vive en la zona D. Villa Hermosa en Huaycan, esta conviviendo y tiene un hijo, lleva cuatro años trabajando con Edaprospo en el grupo “Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa”, grupo conformado por 10 vecinos y amigos, además el grupo escogió el nombre indican: “Por que viven en la Villa y son hermosas”, La señora Maribel por su parte atienD. en un restaurante y venD. comida desD. hace 5 años, también venD. ropas D. temporada a pedido para así juntar dinero y poder en el futuro comprar su casa y para esto necesita que Edaprospo le siga brindando su ayuda.
texts.en:
Ms. Maribel is 31 years old and lives in the Villa Hermosa ["Beautiful Village"] zone of of Huayacan.  She is in a common-law marriage and has one son.  She has been working with Edaprospo for four years, with the "Florecitas D. Villa Hermosa" ["Little Flowers of Villa Hermosa"] group.  This group is maD. up of ten neighbors and friends.  They chose their group's name "because they live in the Villa and they are beautiful."

For her part, Ms. Maribel tends to a restaurant and has been selling food for five years.  In order to bring in enough money, she also sells seasonal clothing on order.  In the future, she wants to be able to buy her own house, so she needs the continued support that Edaprospo has offered her.

loans.use: to buy products and ingredients

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida V. is from the village of Naggasican Santiago City. She is 28 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she sells vegetables, fruits and fish. Leonida has been in business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASK to purchase additional products to sell. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 
                                                        
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folks and small-business entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eusebio Ricardo

texts.es:
Eusebio G., un hombre  de 60 años y casado,  llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 11 años, procedente del municipio de Cereté, lugar donde vivía; el trabajaba en Cerromatoso, gran productor en Colombia de ferroníquel, o aleación de hierro y níquel, en el departamento de Córdoba, de donde hoy espera su pensión. 
Eusebio  vive en el barrio 7 de Abril y es propietario de la “Tienda los Abuelos”, negocio que inició por recomendación de su hermana y es hoy una fuente de ingreso y empleo para él y su esposa y por eso ambos son conocidos en el sector como “los abuelos”.  Este es su sexto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y esta aplicando a su primer credikiva para comprar víveres productos no perecederos, arroz, aceite, harina y azúcar  en mayor proporción, para ganar descuentos y continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia que es su fortaleza, lo que le augura éxitos en su inversión.
Desde que inició su historia crediticia en la Fundación su negocio ha crecido, porque cada crédito es una adición a su capital de trabajo que le permite expandirse al tener todos los productos  que sus clientes requieren de manera asequible.
texts.en:
Euesbio G., 60 years old and married, moved to the city of Barranquilla, Colombia 11 years ago from the municipality of Cerete where he used to live.  He used to work at Cerromatoso, a large producer of ferronickel - an alloy of iron and nickel - in the department of Cordoba; he is now waiting for his retirement pension from this company. Eusebio lives in the 7 de Abril neighborhood in Barranquilla, and he owns the "Tienda los Abuelos" (Grandparents' Store), a business that he began at his sister's suggestion. The store is now a source of income and employment for him and his wife, and because of this, both are known in the area as "the grandparents." 

This is Eusbio's sixth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he is applying for his first Kiva credit to buy non-perishable goods, such as rice, oil, flour, and sugar, in bulk so that he can buy at a discount and continue offering excellent service, which will help him succeed in his investment.  His business has grown since be began taking out credit with the Foundation, because each loan is an addition to his work capital that allows him to expand to have all the products that his customers need at an affordable price.  Through this growth, the couple has been able to sustain their business well.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk non-perishable goods, such as rice, oil, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang K., 29, is married to Mr. Phan Srim, 28, a local farmer. They live in Kompong Cham province. Neang K. is talented at making bamboo baskets for the market. She also helps her husband farm and plant rice. She and her husband go through the village seeking bamboo. They then take the bamboo home, put it in water for almost a week and then dry it in the sunshine for at least three days. They split the bamboo into smaller pieces, which she and her husband use to make baskets.

Neang K. is now asking for a loan to help her breed pigs to provide the family with extra income. The loan money will be used to buy piglets and many sacks of pig feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Rachel's Group

texts.en:
Rachel R. is from the village of Luyao Luna, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Rachel is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rachel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rachel owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rachel has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rachel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first taken out by Rachel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 38 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his sisters and his own family, and his dream is to educate them.

He has a retail shop and has been operating it for three years amid challenges of high rental fees and taxes. 

Amos started as a builder, then saved to start the retail shop. His goal is to become a wholesale trader. 

Amos needs the loan to buy soap, rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina A. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Divina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells nipa (woven Nipa palm fronds for a thatched roof) for the local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately $38 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Divina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to add capital to her business. 

Divina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for nipa production. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for nipa production

loans.name: Yeny Margot

texts.es:
Yeny  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.
La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos.  Hace cuatro meses trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo  de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará productos cosméticos para poder abastecerse para la campaña del día de la madre.
 Su sueño es tener más capital y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yeny is a member of the comunal bank Victor Echave located in the district of Puno, a province and department of Puno.  She is single with 2 children and counts on a secondary education.
She sells perfumery and cosmetic products.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement four months now and her initial loan of 300 nuevo soles was invested in her business of cosmetic products.  With this new loan of 300 nuevo soles she will purchase cosmetic products in order to stock up for the Mother's Day campaign.  Her dream is to have more capital and improve her earnings.  What she likes most about her comunal bank is the loan facility.

loans.use: to purchase various cosmetics

loans.name: Zaur

texts.ru:
Zaur yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Zaur B. 36 let. 
Zaur seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec dlya prodaji. On takje delayet iz shersti ovec tepliye zimniye jeleti i prodayot ix.
texts.en: Zaur is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who know lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He is married and has a child.  Zaur B. is 36 years old. Zaur now needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep to expand his flock for resale.  He has been a shepherd for seven years and breeds sheep for resale.  He also makes warm winter vests from wool and sells them.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Jesus Nazareno

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y es conocido por ser una persona responsable y trabajadora que goza de muy buenas referencias personales, por parte de sus vecinos. Él vive en una campiña en la zona rural del distrito Razuri perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope.

Jesús se dedica a la compra y venta de espárrago y cuenta con gran experiencia en este negocio. Es conocido en su comunidad  y trabaja con los agricultores de la zona que lo consideran un amigo.

Jesús ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que desea invertir en su negocio. Con este préstamo Jesús quiere comprar espárrago de campos de cultivo para comercializarlo a su distinta clientela.

Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran utilidad para su negocio y desarrollo personal así como económico.
texts.en:
Jesús, 28, is single and known for being a responsible, hard working person who has very good personal references from his neighbors.  He lives out in the countryside in the rural part of Razuri District which belongs to Ascope Province.

Jesús is an asparagus merchant.  He has a lot of experience in this business.  He’s known in the community and works with the local farmers who consider him a friend.

Jesús has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to invest in the business.  Jesús plans to use this loan to buy asparagus from the field to sell to his various customers.

He would be very grateful if this loan were granted because it would be very useful for his business as well as his personal and economic development.

loans.use: to buy asparagus to sell.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban, de 49 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí vive desde hace 12 años en su casa propia, cuidando con mucho esmero de sus cultivos. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura; donde trabaja arduamente en su siembra, con el tiempo logró obtener 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas propios. Desde entonces cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plátanos y café, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Pero en temporada de cosecha de café, que se realiza una vez al año, vende su producción a la cooperativa de la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. “Me gusta sembrar”, concluye. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de Café” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Esteban de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus cultivos de café que recién sembró. Asimismo en el pago del salario a los peones que le están apoyando en esta campaña de cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Esteban, age 49, resides in the community of Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle. He has lived there for 12 years and owns a home. Esteban looks after his crops with great care. His main business activity is farming. He works hard on his farm where he owns four hectares of land. Every morning he wakes up early so that he can water and look after his banana and coffee plants. Esteban sells his produce in the city of La Merced where he is able to get the best prices for his crops. During the coffee harvesting season, which occurs once a year, he sells his coffee beans to a cooperative in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar. What he enjoys most about his job is the freedom of working in the green fields. Esteban has been farming for 10 years and considers the most difficult part to be having to work every day because he is left with little time to devote to other activities. Later on, he hopes to acquire more land so that he can grow citrus fruits because these items currently sell the best. “I enjoy farming,” says Esteban.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Aroma de Café” (Scent of Coffee) and will be receiving his third loan from MFP. Esteban hopes that this support will help him achieve his goals. For this reason, he promises once again to complete his payments on time, just as he did with his previous loans. He is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. With the loan he received, Esteban will invest in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on the coffee plants he recently planted. In addition, he will pay the salary of his workers who have helped him during the coffee harvesting season.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and to pay the salary of his workers.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 29 years old, hard working and self motivated. She is married and blessed with three children aged 7, 5 and 4 years old. Everlyne sells spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid for motor vehicles. Prior to this, she had a retail shop.

Through Faulu Kenya, Everlyne has learned how to save and to manage her business. She wants a loan of 20,000 KES to buy engine oil, spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid. Everlyne wants to be a well established businesswoman with several outlets in town in the next 5 years. Her dream is to be a major distributor of motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid

loans.name: El Firmamento 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Merki is the coordinator of her group, El Firmamento 1 & 2 (The Firmament). This is a group composed of 10 business women. All of them are working to improve their lives and their families' also. They live in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city.

Merki makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She is a young mother of 26. She is excited to be seeking her third loan with Esperanza. She successfully paid off her previous loan after using it to make a successful investment in her beans sales. She boils them to sell to her neighbors. (This is a way many women in the Dominican Republic buy beans for daily meals, specially for lunch. They finish cooking the beans.) She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying three bags of beans. 

She is saving her profits because she is planning to expand her business with more products. She dreams of having a grocery store. Her most difficult challenge has been studying and take care of her babies. She likes to work and her future plan is to have her own house. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy beans to boil and sell.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met, 54 years old, sells cakes.  Her income is $4 per day. She is a single mother with 5 children, two of whom are studying.  The other three are workers earning $9 per day.  Every month Met has to spend $66 on food, $7.5 on electricity, $26 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $14 on other expenses.  She sells many kinds of cake to offer her customers and can sell alot of cake because her cakes taste good. She expects to send the rest of her children to study at the university so that they can find good jobs. 

She would like a loan of $800 to buy a plot of land for planting.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for planting.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo) is 36 years old and her husband, Chamreun is 37 years old.  They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have two sons and two daughters.  Two are married and live outside the family home.  The other two work in a restaurant.   

Srey is a gardener, while her husband is a construction worker.  She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting and she will use part of the loan to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting and to repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: Lelis de 47 años de edad se dedica a la actividad comercial en su casa ubicada al suroccidente de la ciudad, donde vive con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 20 a 24 años. Procedente de Aracataca, desde muy niña llegó a la ciudad de BarranquilL., donde formó su familia y desde hace 6 años se separó de su cónyuge y asumió las riendas de su hogar, pues desde hace 21 años ya era trabajadora independiente, vendía mercancías variada y también bebidas. Su negocio de mercancía lo distribuye en los municipios del departamento del Magdalena donde tiene su principal clientele,  a quienes les vende ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y artículos que le solicitan, especialmente cuando se acercan las fiestas patronales y eventos que conglomeran muchos potenciales clientes. Su negocio de venta de bebidas, lo desarrolle todos los días, los fines de semana aumentan sus ventas, pues  usualmente son  épocas de pago de nóminas, quincenas o décadas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará, bebidas en mayor volumen, así como ropa que tiene encargada y accesorios femeninos, con ello ganaría descuentos por las compras en mayor volumen y de contado y aquí radica el éxito de su inversión. Su sueño más adelante es tener una casa donde pueda adecuar su negocio en un espacio confortable para ella su familia y que los clientes se sientan muy bien atendidos por la comodidad que este lugar le inspire. Mientras todo esto ocurre, Lelis se esmera en su negocio diariamente por aumentar sus ventas, y por sostener su rentabilidad que no es menor del 17,79%, rotación de inventarios de 17 días en la mercancía y en las bebidas, diaria. Su máximo sueño es ver a sus hijos felices en familia y con mucho bienestar.
texts.en:
Lelis, 47, conducts her commercial activity from home which is located in the southwest part of the city where she lives with her four children whose ages range from 20 to 24 years.  She is from Aracataca having arrived as a little girl in BarranquilL. where she eventually formed her family.  Six years ago she separated from her spouse and took on the reins of her household since she has been an independent merchant for the last 21 years selling assorted merchandise and beverages.

She sells her merchandise in towns in Magdalena Department where her main clientele is located.  She sells them clothes, cosmetics, perfumes and other items they request especially when the patron saint feast days or other events approach that gather together lots of potential customers. The beverage sales take place every day and sales rise on weekends because that’s usually when salaries are paid (biweekly or every ten days).

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy larger amounts of beverages as well as clothes she has on order and women’s accessories.  She will earn discounts buying in volume and paying cash and this is where her investment’s success resides.

Her future dream is to have a house where she can set up her business in a space that’s comfortable for her and her family and where customers will feel well cared for due to the comfort the place inspires.  While all this occurs, Lelis strives daily in her business to increase sales to maintain her profit margin which is no less than 17.79%, a stock turnover rate of 17 days for the merchandise and daily for the beverages.  Her main dream is to see her children happy as family with much wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy beverages in larger amounts.

loans.name: Batyi's Group

texts.en: Batyi is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married; her husband went to work in Russia. Batyi has raised two daughters and a son; the daughters are married and the son studies at university. In order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, Batyi breeds livestock; her son helps her in this activity. With the profits gained from reselling livestock, she was able to build a sauna near the house. With money received from the loan, Batyi wants to purchase livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to see her son get wed. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo, a married man with two children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business from home. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business, and dreams of establishing a grocery shop in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, he wants to purchase spare parts and oil to service his motorcycle with a loan of Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and oil to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sylvia Montano Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is 63 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad. She is married with four children. 

Sylvia has a shop that sells assorted groceries and dry goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries worth PHP 10,000.

Sylvia has been a member of PMPC for two years. Sylvia is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries

loans.name: Rapuncel

texts.en:
Rapuncel is 33 years old and married, with 2 children. With one child in school, Rapuncel works very hard to provide for them.  Rapuncel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rapuncel has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, oil, spices, bread, etc.  In the future, Rapuncel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин житель района Дангара. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он таксист, в основном он разводит людей с одного месте на другое. Кроме того два раза в неделю Мухиддин развозит людей по маршруту Дангара - Куляб. Этим видом деятельности он занимается два года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Muhiddin lives in the Dangara district.  He is 26 years old, married and has two children.  He is a taxi driver and primarily transports people from one place to another.  Besides this, Muhiddin transports people along the Dangara  -  Kulob route twice per week.  He has been involved in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car in order to provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new equipment
